results.description:
We are starting a new networking group that will meet the 2nd Wednesday of each month from 6 to 8 pm. This group will host a variety of topics that are broader and open for suggestions by its members. Join us for an exciting new networking group!

This event is a hosted by multiple meetup groups. The amount of RSVP's only represents a small number of the amount of people attending.
results.name: Open Networking (every 2nd Wednesday)

results.description: This meetup is dedicated to having an open networking session to meet different business owners, various careers, students and anyone looking to network with others.
results.how_to_find_us: At Union Station across from Kean University. We'll be in the main dining area in Rock 'n' Joe.
results.name: Open Networking

venue.address_1: 142 Main Street (corner of Franklin and Main - the entrance is off the rear parking lot)
venue.name: Helen Hayes Studios

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music and developing your dance technique, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality in depth instruction.

The atmosphere is relaxed and noncompetative, where questions are an encouraged and a valued part of our learning process.

The ballet Instruction is grounded in the Italian and Russian classical traditions. It is guided by a focus on the dancer's bio-mechanics, as effected by their body placement and rhythmic dynamics. 

Whether you are continuing your training or returning to ballet, this is the class for you. Ballet also provides a strong foundation for other dance techniques. Whether your central dance interest is classical dance or other techniques this will a valuable class for you.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.

Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).

Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR

Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK

For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.
results.name: ADULT BALLET CLASS Level: Intermediate

THE WESTWOOD 438 NORTH AVENUE, GARWOOD, NJ

New Jersey Real Estate Social Network Agenda:

6:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. Meet and Greet-Networking

6:45 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. New Attendee Orientation

7:00 p.m - 7:20 p.m. Speed Networking at Round Tables

7:20 p.m. - 7:30 p.m. Vendor/Sponsor Introductions & Questions

7:20 p.m. - 7:50 p.m. Food is served and Networking Takes Place


8:05 p.m. - 9:05 p.m.  How to save a ton of money on taxes and protect your assets by NCH


9:05 p.m. - 10:00 p.m. Networking


Watch this video to see what we're all about:

IF YOU'RE NOT YET A MEMBER AND WOULD LIKE TO BECOME ONE PLEASE CHECK OUT OUR MEMBERSHIP SIGN UP PAGE BY CLICKING HERE

CLICK FOR VIDEO





We're a group of real estate investors, agents, lenders, etc that meet a couple times a month to network, exchange ideas, and grow our businesses through referrals and education.

Cost for main event is as follows:

Average Attendance = 220 people

First time attendees: You do NOT need to be a member for your first event attended and the door fee is $25 (Dinner Included)


Returning attendees: NJRESN is Members Only (after your first event)

Membership = $399.99 for 1 year (12 events) and $25 at the Door (Dinner Included) IMPORTANT: Last chance discounted membership of $299.99 ends 1/13/2016.

To set up your NJRESN membership click HERE

Thanks in advance,

Jon Steingraber
Chris Steingraber
and the NJRESN Team

group.name: New Jersey Real Estate Social Network

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Hi all, 

We'll continue with practice case interviews. We take turns working through and giving cases, usually getting through 1 or 2 per person. Please come prepared to work through some cases (i.e., bring paper, pens, and some practice cases). All experience levels are welcome.

Location: Tasty Cafe, 128 Madison Ave New York, NY 10016 b/t 30th St & 31st St in Midtown East

Nearest Train Stations: 
33rdSt. (6) 
34th St. Herald Sq. (B, D, F, M, N, Q, R) 
33rd St. (PATH) 

Hope to see you there!

ABOUT US:  We focus on practicing management consulting case interview preparation.   Whether you are a seasoned professional or just looking to land your first dream job at a high-flying consulting firm, you've come to the right place! Aside from solving business cases, the group is also great place to meet and network with others interested in management consulting.

All experience levels are welcome, from absolute beginners to seasoned consultants looking for extra practice.

Our group is open to students and professionals across the globe.  

Case Interview Practice Partner - Case Interview Practice Questions - Case Interview Practice Cases - Case Interview Practice Preparation
results.name: Case Interview Practice

results.description:
Join us for our weekly hacknight for Django developers + newcomers to work on their projects and/or connect with other developers. For best results, bring your laptop.

There will be no food provided at this event, so please fill up before or after you drop in!

Say hello on IRC! We're #django-nyc on Freenode.

About our host Rise


Rise New York is a global community of start-ups and corporates creating the future of commerce and fintech by helping startups and entrepreneurs connect, co-create, and scale innovation. In partnership with Barclays, we listen, nurture and oxygenate through our international network of Rise hubs. Rise New York also houses a world-class event space and is home to the U.S. cohort of the Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars.
results.name: Weekly Django Hacknight @ Rise

results.description:
Meet with physics enthusiasts  and the founders of the startup Fiat Physica to discuss all things Physics.  Whether you are a researcher, entrepreneur, or just an avid physics and science fan, come out for a drink! Located inside the Bryant Park Hotel, down the stairs to the left.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: For the Love of Physics: Science, Cocktails and Networking

results.description:
If you've been wondering how to add some humor to your presentations, whether formal or informal, come to a meeting of Humorous Toastmasters.  This is a "specialty" club - open to anyone interested in joining, but which specializes in encouraging experimentation with humor in every aspect of the meeting, from introductions to prepared speeches.  As our club president used to say, we're not funny people, we're people trying to become funnier.

For more information about Toastmasters program, go to www.Toastmasters.org
results.how_to_find_us: This is near 7th Ave. on W. 14th Street
results.name: NO MEETING 12.30; See you at Flannery's 1.13.2016! Guest speaker Bob Bowes

results.description:
This is a continuation of the writing workshop from last week.

Malachy Murray has developed a simple, practical introduction to the art, craft, and mechanics of screenwriting. As a nationally recognized entertainer, storyteller and communicator.  Malachy demonstrates a mix of talents and skills that are unique in the entertainment industry.  Mr. Murray is the author of the best-selling book; UNIQUE NEW YORK and is credited with the following screenplays: Militeddy Bears, A Witch Haven Horror, Red Right Wrong, City Boys, One More Tomorrow, It Happened At Stoney End, Alpha Wolf, The Howies, Lugh (series).
results.name: Writing Workshop & Film Co-Op Meeting

results.description:
Please join WOB for our first meetup of 2016! This is a happy hour event--discounted drinks and food available for purchase. We will have some time for informal networking so you can get to know fellow women business owners, followed by an icebreaker and discussion. We also want to use this meeting to gather your thoughts and ideas on how to make this a helpful group going forward so we hope you can make it!

***The purpose of WOB is to create a space for women business owners across industries and professions to build community, share experiences, resources and have fun. Our goal is to build a network of dynamic, talented and supportive women to share in the excitement and challenges of owning our own businesses. This is an inclusive group with the caveat that participants should have an ownership stake in a women owned business. ***
results.name: Let's start community building!

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

When you arrive you will have the option to join the NYSN Power Ball Pool for $10.  Each person will sign up on a sheet so we can document your participation.  We will buy as many tickets from the money we collect at approx 8:30pm.  We will scan all the tickets and send them via email to all participants.  If we win we all share the jackpot! 


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Power Ball Pool & New & Existing Member Welcome Party--Free Event

group.name: Adventures & Activities With New Friends Social Group NYC

results.description:
6:00pm   Networking


6:30pm   Introduction of SoPE and attendees.  
           Craig Kenesky, Wilson Sonsini

7:15pm   The Art of Hiring. Every business owner will need to engage and hire all sorts of staff and professional advisers.   What sets new entrepreneurs apart is the need to engage or hire people critical to business success.  This includes independent business advisers, regulatory advisers, advisers that may serve on a Board or become Directors, C-suite, and professional advisers including lawyers and accountants to name a few.  Most providers such as physicians have experience hiring subordinate staff.  How does one find and engage superiors?  Leading this discussion will be the following panelists:
   Ren Capocasale, Founder and CEO, Flowmetric
   Kate Rochlin, Founder and CSO, Immunovent  
   Brian Yarnell, President, Bluestream Health

8:15pm   Company Presentation.  Steve Levine, CEO, dB Diagnostic Systems, Inc.

9:00pm    Networking


This meeting is free for all SoPE members.  Membership will be verified at www.sopenet.org.  All others will be required to pay a $100 door fee.
results.name: Meeting of the Society of Physician Entrepreneurs (SoPE), NY Tristate Chapter

group.name: Society of Physician Entrepreneurs (SoPE): New York TriState

results.description:
This meetup group is in association with the DaniWeb Queens & Long Island Techie Meetup.

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.
results.how_to_find_us: Bell Blvd. in Bayside between 38th and 39th
results.name: Pizza Party - Learn, Network, Eat, Hang Out

Meet the team behind physics startup Fiat Physica and mingle over cocktails and common interests. Whether you're a researcher, educator, entrepreneur, or simply an avid physics or science fan, come out for a drink! We'll be by the bar in the back at Cellar Bar (inside the Bryant Park Hotel - go through lobby to the left and downstairs).

1- When you arrive you will have the option to join the NYSN Power Ball Pool for $10.  Each person will sign up on a sheet so we can document your participation.  We will buy as many tickets from the money we collect at approx 8:30pm.  We will scan all the tickets and send them via email to all participants.  If we win we all share the jackpot! 

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
Greetings, members of NYC Inter-Connected Professionals Networking Group!

It is wonderful to watch our membership numbers hit 90 professionals from diverse fields!  We welcome new people as well!

Two great ways to get more business and expand our client or customer base include: (1) live networking -- as in at our event at Pranna on Jan 13th -- and (2) an updated, effective social media marketing strategy.  Need some advice on how to better maximize social media, to grow your online network, increase "SEO," and improve connections with potential clients?  Join us for a night of networking (with guest speaker Michael McKay!) 

Date: Wed, Jan 13th, from 6pm to 9pm at The Pranna Lounge!

Speaker: Michael McKay Entrepreneur, Strategic Marketer,  
https://www.linkedin.com/in/michaeltmckay


Topic: How to Increase Brand Awareness using Social Media

Mixed Open Networking To Follow, After Michael's Informative Presentation!

Note that our prior attendees have come back more than once, and we usually receive only positive reviews. Come check us out for yourself, if you'd like!

Sincerely, 

Eric Sarver, Esq. 


Founder & Organizer -
The NYC Inter-Connected Professionals Networking Group
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in a private section -- either downstairs or near the couches in this comfortable lounge...

Conversations is a series of events focused on open discussions on the changing new media landscape. Our events will feature panels with insights from the most respected news organizations, the newest disruptive publishers, and tech and media thought leaders. Through conversations, let’s work to transform media together. 

For our January event, the Daily News Innovation lab presents teenage speakers who will talk about their relationship with tech and media from the POV of consumers and makers. This is a great opportunity to better understand how the issues the tech and startup communities discuss impact this generation and how they feel about them. From how they consume media, to how they learn, to digital activism, you'll hear first-hand accounts from Gen Z about the changes and creative possibilities new technologies have brought to their lives.

PANELISTS

* Sydney Polinchock (Montclair Kimberley Academy)

* William Goodall (Montclair Kimberley Academy)

* MODERATOR: David Polinchock 

SCHEDULE 

6:00-6:30: Registration / Networking Reception 
6:30-7:30: Panel discussion and Q&A 
7:30-8:30: Networking Reception

Presented by the Daily News Innovation Lab (http://www.nydn.us/lab).

results.description:
If you've been wondering how to add some humor to your presentations, whether formal or informal, come to a meeting of Humorous Toastmasters.  This is a "specialty" club - open to anyone interested in joining, but which specializes in encouraging experimentation with humor in every aspect of the meeting, from introductions to prepared speeches.  As our club president used to say, we're not funny people, we're people trying to become funnier.

The 2nd Wednesday each month we meet here at Jimmy's - a lovely bar where we have a backroom with mini stage, cafe tables, and a lower east side atmosphere.  The 4th Wednesday of each month we meet in a corporate environment midtown (watch for those announcements too!)

For more information about the international Toastmasters program, go to www.Toastmasters.org
results.how_to_find_us: This is between 7th and 8th Avenues - club meets in the room down the stairs in the back of the bar.
results.name: Come to Humorous Toastmasters!

Dress code is Casual Smart!

results.description:
This meetup group was started by the founder of the DaniWeb.com IT Discussion Community who was getting frustrated that all of the meetups she was interested in attending were based in NYC, and it was nearly impossible to get to them on weeknights for people who work out on Long Island.

Join a group of people who work in the tech industry throughout Long Island.

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.
results.how_to_find_us: Parking on Bell Blvd. is not metered after 7 pm. We are located in office space above Clifford Optical and the Allergy and Asthma Family Care Center. We have our own door leading upstairs to the right of the medical office.
results.name: DaniWeb Techie Meetup - 2nd Wed of the Month

Learn the new and exciting sport of rock climbing! We will provide training for first-timers on first day. Also, the gym runs 'Climbing 101' classes which instruct on how to climb, tie the basic knots, belay fellow climbers

How to Tie A Figure 8 Knot-

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CrxgWU2BFBM

How to Belay -

GYM PRICING/REQUIREMENT: *Cliffs Liability Waiver: Must Fill Out when you get in the Gym  

Day Pass: $24 including shoes and harness rental


Meetup Benefits for Cliffs Membership: 
Free Initiation Fee 
Current Monthly Membership Charge 
3 extra day free passes 
Please let me know if you have questions


HOW TO FIND THE GROUP IN THE GYM:  We will assemble by the couch until 615p; however, if you are late, please walk around to find us. Look for people with rental gear and I will be wearing my camouflage cap so members can spot me. PLEASE DO NOT BE AFRAID TO ASK. THE GYM GETS CROWDED BUT ARE DEF AROUND. 


Location: THE CLIFFS AT LONG ISLAND CITY 

[masked]th Dr
Long Island City
Queens, NY 11101

The Cliffs at Long Island City is the largest rock climbing gym on the east coast! The walls range from beginner to expert difficulty, so there is something to climb for everyone. If you have ever wanted to try rock climbing for the first time, or if you're a pro, this is the place to do it!


Getting Here:

Subway:
E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days

Metro North & LIRR:

From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square.

***AFTER  our HARD night of climbing, we will grab beer and BBQ at John Brown's which is a block away from the Cliffs. 

****DUE TO LIMITED SPOTS, NO SHOWS OR LAST MINUTE CANCELLATIONS WILL BE NOTED***

results.description:
This meetup is for all book lovers who would like to come together under one roof, exchange and discuss their books with. This is a great way of getting rid of your old books and to take something new back home. For now, lets not focus on a genre and just bring our favorite books. Lightly used books are totally fine! 

HOW IT WORKS:
Bring a book that you recommend to someone. We can discuss books while enjoying Art Cafe's drinks and food! 

*If you want to bring more than one book, you are welcome to! Magazines are also welcome!

*We'll have a raffle to determine who will get to pick the books first. 

*Latecomers will get to go on a first-come, first-serve basis.

*I'll bring some post it notes and pens so you can write notes to explain why you love the books that you brought. This'll help everyone pick their books and give some context!

Can't wait to read and talk with everyone!
results.name: Book swap and discussion at Art Cafe

results.description:
Hello New York Composers, Musicians, Lyricists and Singers,

I've been a singer/songwriter in NYC for 11 years and for the past 4 years I have owned my own rehearsal studio in Midtown Manhattan. When I first moved to New York I took recorded sound classes, but realized that my passion was the live show and I wanted to learn about live sound to make my shows better. Now I have this knowledge and I've noticed that there are no classes offered on this topic. It is vital knowledge. I taught my first class in March 2015 and because it was so successful I'm now regularly doing these workshops.

Below you will find the details and the link to reserve a spot.

I look forward to meeting you!

-Sarah

Live Sound Workshop for Beginners

Date:

Weds, Jan 13th, 2016, 6-10PM

Location:

Popmod Studios
584 Eighth AVE (between 38th and 39th ST)
New York, NY 10018 

Overview:

You will leave this workshop and be able to walk into your next gig and know exactly what to say to the person running sound. We will focus on very practical knowledge that you can apply right away.

Cost:

Order Now, Space is Very Limited! The workshop costs $75 and RVSP here to attend!..http://www.eventbrite.com/e/live-sound-workshop-for-beginners-tickets-19020614169

What is "Live Sound?"


"Live Sound" is a term used to describe the sound techniques utilized in a live venue when there's an audience in attendance. This expertise is different than what's called "recorded sound," which is the way music is recorded in the recording studio.

Most classes and workshops exclusively focus on "recorded sound" techniques and can leave performers without vital skills when they go on stage to perform live. If you've ever taken ProTools classes or recording classes, you are still a beginner in live sound techniques and are in need of this workshop.

Is this Workshop for You?

This interactive live sound workshop is for you if you are doing gigs (or looking to do gigs) and want to know how to communicate clearly and professionally with the live sound engineers in NYC venues.

After completing the workshop you will also be able to do basic sound for yourself if you encounter the NYC venues that require this skill. (Surprisingly, there are some great ones that have the bartender point you to the mixer and leave you to do it all yourself!)

Who This Workshop is Not For

This is not for anyone who already has extensive live sound experience. This is a beginner level class geared towards performers.

If you are not a performer you are welcome to attend, but know that the class will be taught with the performer in mind.

Skills You'll Learn

• Mic Stand Setup Trick

• Pro Cable Wrapping Techniques

• EQ, Compression, and Reverb

• Basics of the Mixer (Also known as a "Sound Board" or "Desk")

• Much More! 

Questions You'll Be Able to Answer 

• Why can't I hear myself?

• Why did I just hear that horrible feedback?

• What are the different pieces of gear all around the sound person?
results.name: Live Sound Workshop for Beginners - Paid Event

group.name: New York Composers, Musicians, Lyricists and Singers

iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.  

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Ultimaker 2

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance 


• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!

results.description:
As fast as organization needs are changing, so are the ways which employers seek talent. As we continue to move further and further away from 30 years with the same employer, we are also moving away from predictable positions with stable requirements. Start the new year by doing things in new ways! Learn how to adapt to this new market and achieve success in your career.

Win Sheffield discusses:

- Change as the new normal
- The compromises you won't have to make
- What stays the same and what changes
- How to enlist support so the change process is not a solo activity
- Learning about options you had not known about
results.name: A B C's of Changing Careers with Win Sheffield

Order Now, Space is Very Limited! The workshop costs $75 and RVSP here to attend!..http://www.eventbrite.com/e/live-sound-workshop-for-beginners-tickets-19020614169

Live Sound Workshop for Beginners

What is "Live Sound?"

"Live Sound" is a term used to describe the sound techniques utilized in a live venue when there's an audience in attendance. This expertise is different than what's called "recorded sound," which is the way music is recorded in the recording studio.

Most classes and workshops exclusively focus on "recorded sound" techniques and can leave performers without vital skills when they go on stage to perform live. If you've ever taken ProTools classes or recording classes, you are still a beginner in live sound techniques and are in need of this workshop.

Is this Workshop for You?

This interactive live sound workshop is for you if you are doing gigs (or looking to do gigs) and want to know how to communicate clearly and professionally with the live sound engineers in NYC venues.

After completing the workshop you will also be able to do basic sound for yourself if you encounter the NYC venues that require this skill. (Surprisingly, there are some great ones that have the bartender point you to the mixer and leave you to do it all yourself!)

Who This Workshop is Not For

This is not for anyone who already has extensive live sound experience. This is a beginner level class geared towards performers.

If you are not a performer you are welcome to attend, but know that the class will be taught with the performer in mind.

Skills You'll Learn

• Mic Stand Setup Trick

• Pro Cable Wrapping Techniques

• EQ, Compression, and Reverb

• Basics of the Mixer (Also known as a "Sound Board" or "Desk")

• Much More! 

Questions You'll Be Able to Answer 

• Why can't I hear myself?

• Why did I just hear that horrible feedback?

• What are the different pieces of gear all around the sound person?
results.name: Live Sound Workshop for Beginners - Paid Event

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

When you arrive you will have the option to join the NYSN Power Ball Pool for $10.  Each person will sign up on a sheet so we can document your participation.  We will buy as many tickets from the money we collect at approx 8:30pm.  We will scan all the tickets and send them via email to all participants.  If we win we all share the jackpot! 

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Power Ball Pool & New & Existing Member After Work  Party--Free Event

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. results.description:
We'll explore a use case involving packet capture and near-real-time query and search, starring Apache Spark and Apache Drill. There will be a discussion of the use case, solution approach and a live demo.

Presenter: Vince Gonzalez

The use case I'll be covering involves live packet capture using tcpdump, Spark Streaming to process the incoming PCAP files, as well as Elasticsearch and Apache Drill for search and query over the data. I'll talk about the approach we took to building this, some of the challenges we faced and time permitting I'll do a demo.

Pizza and beverages (including beer, bring your ID, WeWork needs to card - it's the law) will be served.
results.name: Querying Network Packet Captures with Spark and Drill

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the restaurant owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consumes something. The restaurant also has a bakery attached with treats. To show our appreciation for allowing us to play here weekly please try to spend at least $5. We play in the restaurant; to get there, you enter the bakery walk to the back, then make a right. There you'll find the restaurant, we are located by the front windows.

• The bakery is located across the street from Mitchell's restaurant. There is a lighted OPEN sign on the window.

• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.

results.description:
Tired of the rat race? We don't blame you... But no need to worry!!! Come to our CashFlow in Jersey City and learn how to get out of the rat race while having fun.


During the CashFlow in Jersey City you will see how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the fast track where your money works for you instead of you working hard for money to pay liabilities. You will also have the opportunity to network with local successful real estate investors and learn from their strategies.


Use this game to practice real world investing with play money. Cashflow in Jersey City is an educational board game that teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time. It makes learning fun and is recommended for adults and children age 10 and older.

We create a perfect environment to meet new people, make friends, and learn to make smart financial decisions so you can get out of the rat race for good. This board game teaches people how to think like a successful real estate investor. It brings out your investment style and shows you why you are successful or not. It is Monopoly on Steroids.

This meet up is by invitation only, so you need to answer the questions in the RSVP for us to be able to contact you with the details of this event.

results.description:
The Beginner Buddhist Book Circle is for anyone interested in or new to Buddhism. In this biweekly series, we’ll explore classic introductory Buddhist books. Although we have “reading assignments”, the meetings focus more on basic Buddhist teachings rather than strict discussions of the books. Our meetings are casual and informal; all levels of interest and experience are welcome. When possible, we’ll have copies of the current book available at no cost. Meetings occur on the second Wednesday and fourth Thursday of the month unless otherwise noted. Please see the Meetup page and calendar for the full schedule.

*** Right Now We’re Reading: “The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" by Thich Nhat Hanh***

In "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings", renowned Vietnamese Buddhist monk, teacher, poet, and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) presents the essentials of Buddhist teachings in a clear, compassionate, and concise manner. In addition to covering teachings at the core of all Buddhist traditions, Thay also covers many key Mahayana Buddhist teachings. In all discussions, Thay helps guide us to the heart of what the Buddha taught; the transformation of suffering into peace, joy, and liberation.

First released in 1999, "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" has become a classic and essential read for anyone interested in learning more about basic Buddhist teachings. The book is widely available in bookstores and libraries in print, ebook form, and audio book form.

For the Jan. 13th meeting, please read Chapters 14 and 15.

Discussion points include:

-What is "diligence" in the spiritual context?

-What are the different kinds of concentration in Buddhist teachings?


***

Happy reading and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: Beginner Buddhist Book Circle

results.description:
Social Paint & Drink Night (Must Pre-Pay Online)
Get tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html (No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event usually sells out by the event day so get your tickets now)

WHERE: Irish Exit Bar & Lounge - 978 2nd Ave (at 52nd St), New York, NY 10022
WHEN: Wednesday, January 13th 2016: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html
results.name: Social Paint & Drink Night (Must Pre-Pay Online)

results.description:
Organized by NYC Data Science Academy Alumni , you can also apply for Jan 2016 program to become a Data Scientist.


Every Second and Fourth Wednesday, we will host Kaggle nights for Data Scientists to compete together in NYC. Tonight's topic is "Prudential Life Insurance Assessment"

https://www.kaggle.com/c/prudential-life-insurance-assessment

Come join us to work on Kaggle competitions.  Some meetups will be structured where we guide you through a competition; and others are unstructured where everyone can freely work together.  For the first meetup, it will be a structured session and we'll guide you through importing, cleaning, and visualizing you data.  We'll be demonstrating in R. 

The session is designed so that you can arrive with no preparation and work through a Kaggle competition.  However, you can get more out of it if you prepare in advance.  Let us know what you're working on so that we can prepare too. 

Schedule:

6:30-7:30    open hack time

7:30-8:00   small presentation from experienced competitors

8:00-9:00   open hack time

We encourage you to come early and group teams!
results.name: Kaggle Night - Prudential life insurance assessment (1st session)

results.description:
Random House Publishers have granted us early access to their new book! The first 20 books are free! Join us in January for wine and snacks at Random House office to have Q&A with the author! 


For those who did not attend our book swap, I will hand out remaining copies Wed, January 6 at our next book club. 

// Try Not to Breathe, Holly Seddon
Only 15 years old, Amy disappeared walking home from school one day and was found in a coma three days later. Her attacker was never identified and her angelic face was plastered across every paper and nightly news segment. 


Fifteen years later, Amy lies in the hospital, surrounded by 90's Britpop posters, forgotten by the world until reporter Alex Dale stumbles across her and feels compelled to solve the long-cold case.The only problem is, Alex is just as lost as Amy - her alcoholism has cost her everything including her marriage and her professional reputation. In the hopes that finding Amy's attacker will be her own salvation as well, Alex embarks on a dangerous investigation, suspecting someone close to Amy. 

Told in the present by an increasingly fragile Alex and in dream-like flashbacks by Amy as she floats in a fog of memories, dreams, and music from 1995. 

//Location
Random House Office, 1745 Broadway
Join us at the Random House office where snacks and wine will be provided. We will also Skype in the author for a Q&A!
results.name: Book #5.5 - Try Not to Breathe by Holly Seddon (FREE book!)

group.name: Fiction Addiction: Women Hooked on Books

results.description:
Join fellow technologists, entrepreneurs, and investors for the NY Enterprise Technology Meetup's (NYETM) January meetup on Wednesday 1/13/16 from 6:30pm-9:00pm!

For our January meetup we have a panel discussion and two exciting companies demoing their technologies: 


Panel on "How to get press coverage for your enterprise tech startup" with...

• Jonathan Shieber (TechCrunch)

• Alex Konrad (Forbes)

• Jing Cao (Bloomberg)

• Robert Hackett (Fortune)

• Moderator: Mickey Graham (Work-Bench)


Demos

• Datavore - Datavore is a venture-backed software company founded in 2014 by Goldman Sachs alumni. The company makes an adaptive analytics platform for the Financial Services industry that captures users’ domain expertise in order to conduct and repeat complex analyses in a fraction of the time.  The smart end-to-end solution leverages each user's unique approach to data classification to help merge, clean, manipulate and visualize data.

• VTS - VTS is a cloud-based leasing and portfolio management platform that provides brokers and owners with real-time access to everything happening throughout their portfolio. Tailor made to streamline the entire leasing process, the platform enables tracking and analytics across live, active deal flow. Users get their portfolio and team onto a single platform to interact with data, identify trends, highlight opportunities and quickly raise red flags when necessary. Everyone involved becomes faster and smarter from a mobile phone or desktop.

Sign up today, and if you have any questions, please contact Jon Lehr at [masked]. 


Looking forward to seeing you all soon!

Yours in collaboration, 
Jon  
www.nyetm.com
results.how_to_find_us: Work-Bench is located on 5th Ave between 16/17th Streets
results.name: January 2016 NY Enterprise Technology Meetup

results.description:
Hey New York eCommerce / Magento Meetup Fans,

We’re excited to be kicking off the New Year with an interactive chat with Jay Alson of Bounce Exchange.

Did you ever wish you had the power to accurately predict and prevent when a visitor was going to leave your website before they actually left?

Everyday hundreds of visitors land on a website page and just as many drop off for reasons unbeknownst to you. What if we told you not all visitors are the same? Creating a user experience that is provocative and relevant for visitors is a creative process that takes time.

In today’s world of eCommerce and heavy web traffic, it is highly appropriate to understand your visitors’ interests and help guide them through a successful online experience that will transform a mere window shopper into a loyal customer.

Jay will be addressing the “behavioral” web and how to convert visitors into customers by serving content tailored to different visitor segments and on-site behaviors. By analyzing everything about visitors behavior, from purchase history to traffic sources to engagement patterns to even the moment a visitor is abandoning a site.

A little bit more about Jay Alson:

Jay is a New York native and Director of Business Development at Bounce Exchange. Additionally, Jay runs an iPhone app development company and is a part of the NYC tech community, he also has his pilot’s license!  

About Bounce Exchange:

Bounce Exchange is a cutting edge digital marketing platform enabling its clients to transform their web traffic by serving content tailored to different visitor segments and on-site behaviors. Bounce Exchange uses software to analyze everything about visitors behavior, from purchase history to traffic sources to engagement patterns to even the moment a visitor is abandoning a site using its patented exit-intent technology. Bounce Exchange then uses that information to inform a variety of customer acquisition strategies designed to dramatically boost key business metrics for its clients.

http://www.bounceexchange.com/


The Meetup Structure: 

 6:30 -  Doors open for Networking

 7:15 - 30 second introductions from all our members 

 7:30 -Jay will be presenting with a Q&A

8:15-9:30 Pizza and networking  

This Meetup is presented by Hara Partners.
results.name: New York eCommerce Meetup: "The Behavioral Web"

results.description:
Social Paint & Drink Night (Must Pre-Pay Online)
Get tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html (No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event usually sells out by the event day so get your tickets now)

WHERE: Irish Exit Bar & Lounge - 978 2nd Ave (at 52nd St), New York, NY 10022
WHEN: Wednesday, January 13th 2016: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

results.description:
Let's get together and check out this brand spanking new, and very first bricks & mortar location of Cinnamon Snail. This much gushed about vegan eatery has operated as a food truck business for six years this Valentine's. To avoid the runaround with NYC and NJ bureaucracy, they're settling down in a very primetime location with a good number of their signature sandwiches. 

Snail is easily one of NYC's best vegan food makers. Now that they have seating and seemingly awesome location for nearly anyone, let's go.

Please note: The Pennsy and ALL its vendors are barely open one week now. This means we each will need to LOWER our expectations, instead of expecting top notch or perfect service. Consider this to be like seeing a theater show in previews.
results.name: January 2016: OUTING Cinnamon Snail at The Pennsy

venue.name: Real Estate Investing Office

results.description:
Are you tired of just working your day to day grind and jusgetting by? Why not find out how you can get out of the rat race?

The game of Cashflow simulates real-life financial management and features realistic Real Estate investing scenarios designed to show you how these types of transactions work in real life and both helps you learn how to effectively utilize them in their investing strategies. It also helps to find out your investing style, whether you are aggressive in your strategies or conservative so we can see in which of these you are most comfortable. All without the pressures of using your own money.

We will be meeting at a cafe/restaurant in Astoria
results.how_to_find_us: RSVP for exact address
results.name: Play an Informative game of Cashflow 101 & learn how to think like an investor

results.description:
The next Pints 'n' Purls Meetup will be at The Bar at Whole Foods in Columbus Circle from 6:30-9:30 p.m., so drop in anytime you like. Bring your knitting, crocheting, cross-stitching, or whatever else you're working on and prepare for a blast!

I am not sure if this is up to date, but here is the beer <a>menu: http://www.beermenus.com/places/1868-whole-foods-market-columbus-circle</a>;

The bar is on the right past the registers.  Lots of food options!

Feel free to call Deborah ( 914/[masked] )  or Amy ( 347/[masked] ) with any questions. Hope to see you there!

Feel free to come earlier and grab a table.  With our schedules, we can't guarantee an organizer can make it there earlier than 6:30.

We hope that you will consider becoming or renewing your status as a "Pints 'n' Purls Contributor."  These voluntary dues help cover the costs of running the group, which include dues to Meetup.com, prizes for events, thank yous for hosts, etc.   ALL the money goes back into the group.  We are just hoping that you will share in some of the expenses that come out of organizing these fun and friendly events.  You can pay online or in person ($24/year We organize over 70 meetups a year.)
results.how_to_find_us: We are generally at a large table in the back of the restaurant section. Ask the staff if you don't see us- they know where to find us.
results.name: On Tap (the Bar) at Whole Foods Columbus Circle

results.description:
As listed in the details for the January book discussion event, this complimentary event to this month's official book discussion, is held at the Random House office downtown featuring snacks, wine and author appearance by Skype!

Format:

6:30 pm - Guests arrive; wine and cheese served.

6:45 pm - Official welcome from Random House including a brief speech by Linda Marrow, the book's editor. Book discussion follows moderated by Jess Bonet of Random House.

7:30 pm - Skype Q&A with author Holly Seddon


Please note as a courtesy to the Publisher that provided the book copies last month, first spots will be given to the members that attended the book discussion earlier this week followed by those that could not attend but picked up a book. 

Additional spots will then open up to other book club members.

Thanks!

~Hazel Alvarado
results.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing a brown dress & brown boots
results.name: Random House - Try Not to Breathe Event

During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

results.description:
Hey New York NetSuite Meetup, 

We’re excited to be kicking off the New Year with an interactive chat with Jay Alson of Bounce Exchange.

Did you ever wish you had the power to accurately predict and prevent when a visitor was going to leave your website before they actually left?

Everyday hundreds of visitors land on a website page and just as many drop off for reasons unbeknownst to you. What if we told you not all visitors are the same? Creating a user experience that is provocative and relevant for visitors is a creative process that takes time.

In today’s world of eCommerce and heavy web traffic, it is highly appropriate to understand your visitors’ interests and help guide them through a successful online experience that will transform a mere window shopper into a loyal customer.

Jay will be addressing the “behavioral” web and how to convert visitors into customers by serving content tailored to different visitor segments and on-site behaviors. By analyzing everything about visitors behavior, from purchase history to traffic sources to engagement patterns to even the moment a visitor is abandoning a site.

A little bit more about Jay Alson:

Jay is a New York native and Director of Business Development at Bounce Exchange. Additionally, Jay runs an iPhone app development company and is a part of the NYC tech community, he also has his pilot’s license!  

About Bounce Exchange:

Bounce Exchange is a cutting edge digital marketing platform enabling its clients to transform their web traffic by serving content tailored to different visitor segments and on-site behaviors. Bounce Exchange uses software to analyze everything about visitors behavior, from purchase history to traffic sources to engagement patterns to even the moment a visitor is abandoning a site using its patented exit-intent technology. Bounce Exchange then uses that information to inform a variety of customer acquisition strategies designed to dramatically boost key business metrics for its clients.

http://www.bounceexchange.com/


The Meetup Structure: 

 6:30 -  Doors open for Networking

 7:15 - 30 second introductions from all our members 

 7:30 -Jay will be presenting with a Q&A

8:15-9:30 Pizza and networking  

This Meetup is presented by Hara Partners.
results.name: New York NetSuite Group Meetup: "The Behavioral Web"

results.description:
Happy New Year, everyone -- Time to get rolling with 2016!  We're really getting to the first bit of the more powerful applications of causality: computing causal effects!!

This meeting, we'll cover section 3.3 - 3.5 of Pearl's Causality! 

These sections cover, among other things, the back-door criterion!  This is a criterion for (given a causal model) selecting a subset of variables to "control for" to remove confounding bias when you're estimating causal effects.  It turns out that sometimes, adding variables can actually introduce bias (i.e. conditioning on descendants of the effect).  

Do read the material before the meeting, but it's okay if you don't understand all of it! If you get stuck somewhere, make a note of where. It's likely others got stuck in the same place! Try to push through and understand as much of the rest of the material as possible. We'll try to get everyone on the same page at the meeting!

We're an extremely informal group, and the format is generally to put the book up on a screen, and talk through the material. We stop and discuss sticking points (your notes!) throughout, and dwell on definitions and theorems.

You can also ask any questions about the material in our piazza course page, using the access code stats101 ! -- and it supports latex! http://piazza.com/nyc_ml_study_group/fall2015/stats101 

Recommended Pre-requisites:

• Probability Theory (intermediate): Know what a joint and conditional distribution is. Know what marginalizing is. Understand conditional independence. • Causality up to Sec. 3.2. 

• Graphical Models (intermediate): Know how to factorize a graph. Understand what it means for a distribution P to be "Markov relative to" a graph G. Understand what a "Causal Model" is. 

• Analysis (intermediate): Be comfortable with product (big Pi) notation, indices, basic methods of proofs, basics of set theory, analysis notation (e.g. the funny e thing for "is an element of")

Logistical Notes:

• Be sure to be on time! If you're more than 15 minutes late, you may have trouble getting in. • The receptionist may be not downstairs with the guest list promptly at 6:00. If you arrive and the security desk is unaware of the meetup, just hang out until she arrives downstairs to check you in!

• Be sure to bring ID for security! • There will be signs upstairs ("Math Meetup") directing you to the room.
results.name: Discuss 3.3-3.5 of Causality

Want to learn how to make money instead of losing it? Playing Cash Flow 101 with us will help you do that and more. Everyone deserves the opportunity to learn how to make money in a fun game setting. Meet new people, make friends, and learn to make smart financial decisions so you can get out of the rat race in the game and real life for good. You'll also be able to meet local Real Estate Investors that are playing CashFlow in REAL LIFE! This board game teaches people how to think like a successful real estate investor or business owner. It brings out your investment style and shows you why you are successful or not. It is Monopoly on Steroids.


Learn how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the fast track where your money works for you instead of you working hard for your money. Cashflow 101 is an educational board game that teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time. Use this game to practice real world investing with play money. RSVP to come play at our Real Estate Investor office, receive the full address of our location, and have fun learning how to better your finances in real LIFE.

If you want to enjoy a fun evening while learning this is the place to be.

TOTALLY FREE & We recommend that you bring drinks or snacks while you play!


#cashflow101 #robertkiyosaki #getouttheratrace #financialfreedom #fasttrack #realestate

results.description:
Join Maria Konnikova, the New York Times bestselling author of Mastermind, in a compelling investigation into the minds, motives, and methods of con artists—and the people who fall for their cons over and over again

<a href="http://www.mariakonnikova.com/books/the-confidence-game/"></a>While cheats and swindlers may be a dime a dozen, true conmen—the Bernie Madoffs, the Jim Bakkers, the Lance Armstrongs—are elegant, outsized personalities, artists of persuasion and exploiters of trust. How do they do it? Why are they successful? And what keeps us falling for it, over and over again? These are the questions that journalist and psychologist Maria Konnikova tackles in her mesmerizing new book.

http://nycskeptics.squarespace.com/storage/images/events/TheConfidenceGame_JKF_R3_A-199x300.jpg?__SQUARESPACE_CACHEVERSION=1450549561210

From multimillion-dollar Ponzi schemes to small-time frauds, Konnikova pulls together a selection of fascinating stories to demonstrate what all cons share in common, drawing on scientific, dramatic, and psychological perspectives. Insightful and gripping, the book brings readers into the world of the con, examining the relationship between artist and victim. The Confidence Game asks not only why we believe con artists, but also examines the very act of believing and how our sense of truth can be manipulated by those around us.

An audience Q&A, book signing, and a social will follow.

NYCS tries to keep their lectures free and open to the public, but it does cost money to produce the events. Please consider donating to NYCSkeptics or becoming a member. Suggested donation for this talk is $10.
results.name: BOOK EVENT: MARIA KONNIKOVA ON "THE CONFIDENCE GAME"

group.name: The New York City Skeptics Meetup Group

Would you like to get a job as a Product Manager? Join us for this free open doors session to get an overview of our part-time product management course curriculum, meet the lead instructor and have the chance to ask any additional questions that you might have about what it takes to become a product manager in New York City:

http://www.productschool.com/

All our classes are compatible with a regular work schedule and our campus is conveniently located in Manhattan. This is not your traditional lecture class. Expect a healthy mix of group work, one-­on-­ones with mentors, and a hands­-on experience building your own digital product from end to end.

The instructors are professionals with real-world experience working at renowned tech companies and startups

We have assembled a list of local hiring partners who are eagerly looking for our top Product School students.

Takeaways:

• Get an overview of the curriculum and course objectives

• Meet the Lead Instructor and hear about his background

• Have the chance to ask Product School Instructors & Staff questions about their experience

Meet the presenters: 

Mike Duchen is COO at Product School. He has been at four early-stage startups and ran Business Operations at ReTargeter (acquired by Sellpoints). He has four years of experience working closely with Product and Engineering Teams and assists with placing all Product School students with our hiring partners.

Jerome Bland-Sebrien is a product management veteran and team leader who delivers products that drive revenue and delight customers, including ecommerce, digital and social media, mobile apps and SaaS. He has developed, designed, and launched multiple innovative products globally for both established companies and startups including Getty Images, Gilt Group and the Financial times.

Where:

Grind isn’t an office, it’s the antidote to offices. A members-only shared workspace and coworking community dedicated to taking all of the frustrations of working the old way and pulverizing them to a dust so fine it actually oils the wheels of the machine.

Space is limited so be sure to RSVP!

WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING


This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.

results.description:
With the publication of Job, Joseph Roth's 1930 novel about a Galician Jewish family forced to immigrate to New York, Roth's literary reputation skyrocketed. His novel The Radetzky March, which appeared two years later, is almost universally recognized as a classic. Yet Roth’s earlier work, in which he probingly examined the upheavals of his time—particularly the Russian revolution—have only recently been rediscovered. In the United States, a new anthology of his early reportage, The Hotel Years, has just been published by New Directions, and in Germany his newly published essays on Russia have been celebrated by critics and readers alike. Are we experiencing an international Roth Renaissance? Jan Bürger and George Prochnik will discuss one of the most important and enigmatic writers of the modern era, and provide insights into his astonishing body of work with the aid of manuscripts and letters from the Leo Baeck Institute, New York, and the German Literature Archive, Marbach. Jan Bürger is a literary scholar and author. He wrote his dissertation about Hans Henny Jahnn, belongs to the founding editors of the Berlin journal Literaturen, and has worked since 2002 at the German Literature Archive. In addition to numerous contributions to journals and newspapers (including Die Zeit and the Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, he has written Der gestrandete Wal: Das maßlose Leben des Hans Henny Jahnn (2003), Benns Doppelleben oder wie man sich selbst zusammensetzt (2006), Max Frisch: Das Tagebuch (2011) and Der Neckar: Eine literarische Reise (2013). He is also the editor of a number of events including Ich bin nicht innerlich. Annäherungen an Gottfried Benn (2003), Friedrich Schiller: Dichter, Denker, Vor- und Gegenbild (2007), Liebe ist Quatsch. Briefe an Ellinor by Hans Henny Jahnn (with Sandra Hiemer, 2014) Briefwechsel by Alfred Andersch and Max Frisch (2014), as well as Reisen in die Ukraine und nach Russland by Joseph Roth (2015).

George Prochnik has written for the The New York Times, The New Yorker, Bookforum and the LA Review of Books. His most recent book The Impossible Exile: Stefan Zweig at the End of the World received the National Jewish Book Award for Biography/Memoir in 2014. He is editor-at-large for Cabinet magazine.

Photographs reproduced thanks to the generosity of the Leo Baeck Institute.


Details

Language: English
Price: Free admission
[masked]
[masked]
results.name: Talk & discussion: The Unmendable Self: New Perspectives on Joseph Roth
