results.description:
I keep hearing such great things about this place I needed to try it out. It sounds like an interesting concept and the reservation was difficult enough to get that I am optimistic.


The Place:

We are a vegetable-forward restaurant.
This means your evening's menu will be vegetable-leaning with meat and/or fish playing alongside in a more supporting role. Ingredients are based solely on the best of what's available from our farmers, and change upon season and inspiration.

All seating is around an 18-seat central bar. Our communal-style dining is intended to provoke conversation and interaction at your will.

Prepay: The restaurant requires a credit card to secure a reservation so I am asking people to pay upfront. The set menu (only option) is $85 so I am asking people to pay $110 up front ($85 + tax and tip). I will use all of the prepayment to pay the bill. If you order drinks I will charge you after the event. Venmo is preferred but I can also do Paypal and Chase Quickpay. If you have any questions let me know. Prepayment is not refundable.

RSVPs:

Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. If there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to be able to do so. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Semilla - Michelin Star

results.description:
To RSVP fill out the form here --->>> http://eepurl.com/btziMb

Learn How to Get out of the Rat Race in Real Life!

Cashflow 101 is a fun way to learn the basic concepts of Real estate Investing. Your objective throughout the night will be to get out of the rat race and into the fast track! In other words you have to find a way to get out of that 9-5 and step into the life you always wanted to live, the strategies learned in the game can be applied in real life! We're going to show you how me and my team play cashflow in real life and how we help people implement these strategies to get out of the rat race.

How do you get out of the race race you ask?

Your total monthly passive income has to be higher than your total monthly expenses, you're going to learn the importance of acquiring assets vs stacking up liabilities and how you will be able to use your money wisely instead of just using it to pay bills. We're going to show you practical strategies you can use in your life today that will change your perspective about investing and we will shatter some of the myths people have about money.

Cashflow 101 is an educational tool in board game format which aims to teach the players concepts of investing by having their money work for them in a risk free setting (play money) while simultaneously increasing financial literacy and stressing the imperative nature of accountability.


If you have ever played monopoly this game is like monopoly on steroids!  If you're serious about learning and expanding your knowledge about investing in real estate DON'T MISS THIS EVENT!

To RSVP fill out the form here --->>> http://eepurl.com/btziMb
results.name: Cashflow 101- learn how to get out of the rat race in real life!

Join Maria Konnikova, the New York Times bestselling author of Mastermind, in a compelling investigation into the minds, motives, and methods of con artists—and the people who fall for their cons over and over again

<a href="http://www.mariakonnikova.com/books/the-confidence-game/"></a>While cheats and swindlers may be a dime a dozen, true conmen—the Bernie Madoffs, the Jim Bakkers, the Lance Armstrongs—are elegant, outsized personalities, artists of persuasion and exploiters of trust. How do they do it? Why are they successful? And what keeps us falling for it, over and over again? These are the questions that journalist and psychologist Maria Konnikova tackles in her mesmerizing new book.

http://nycskeptics.squarespace.com/storage/images/events/TheConfidenceGame_JKF_R3_A-199x300.jpg?__SQUARESPACE_CACHEVERSION=1450549561210

An audience Q&A, book signing, and a social will follow.

NYCS tries to keep their lectures free and open to the public, but it does cost money to produce the events. Please consider donating to NYCSkeptics or becoming a member. Suggested donation for this talk is $10.
results.name: BOOK EVENT: MARIA KONNIKOVA ON "THE CONFIDENCE GAME"

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Adreanna Limbach

Adreanna's first encounter with Buddhism was in a high school philosophy class where the discourses on The Heart Sutra rocked her worldview in an uncomfortable and exhilarating way.

Following a subsequent decade of flirtation with meditation, she found her home at The Interdependence Project in NYC, where she completed their year-long teacher training immersion, and continues to study, practice and teach alongside those who inspire her path. 

She’s taught meditation as a practical tool for clarity and resilience to corporate offices, middle school students, and served as a lead coordinator of the Meditation Working Group at Occupy Wall Street, bringing daily practice to the volunteers at Zuccotti Park in 2011. 

When she's not on the cushion, she serves as an Executive Coach at The Institute for Compassionate Leadership, a Student Coach at The Institute for Integrative Nutrition, and catalyzes women to rally their resources so that they can find more freedom in business + life in her private practice. Come say Hello to her at www.AdreannaLimbach.com. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!

results.description:
SESSION 1: UNBOXING YOUR DREAMS FOR MORE ENERGY

What could you get done with more ENERGY?

 It seems like "goal setting" is the magic key to everything in both business and life. "Goal setting" NEEDS an EXTRA KICK to move your life forward. You need to go BEYOND goal setting. What's missing? Start with your DREAMS before "IMAGING" the specific goals you desire. The EXTRA-ENERGY to work on NEW goals while still handling daily life is the missing piece. Your goals need emotional energy to work. Where to find more energy?

The amount of energy you can tap is not fixed!

The starting line for health,happiness and life focus is energy. Where can you possibly find more energy? You already eat healthy and exercise regularly. We feel rushed all the time and lose touch with our dreams. Because of stress overload from the rapid pace of modern life our dreams become boxed up inside of our heads. Everyone loves the experience of UNBOXING a new toy. We even love watching others UNBOXING their new toys on YouTube. There is an excitement and adventure about what's possible with a new toy. Have you fully unboxed your dreams? You won't have full energy until you have unboxed your dreams. Dream energy when unboxed provides a wellspring of emotional energy to push you further to get more done.

RSVP Now

Fully unboxed dreams turn up the temperature in your life. Becoming clear about your dreams is not only a renewing experience that feels like a mini vacation. Suddenly, you have MORE energy to handle and do more during your day. Within the cognitive environment of your UNBOXED DREAMS problems at work and home become small stuff. During session 1 you will unbox multiple dreams within the important areas of your life while connecting them together. With "Dream connectivity" you create a psychological pool of unlimited energy to continually recharge yourself.

Put More Energy Into Your Week

Find Out What Organically Motivates You

Gain A Method To Mentally Release Worry And Anxiety 

Make The Process of Figuring Out Your goal-What You Really Want clearer

Click This Discount Link To RSVP -$25.00 At Door

How Do We Unbox Your Dreams?

Dreams are the BIG aspirations that we long towards. Our dreams are A powerful mixture of both fact and fantasy. During Session 1 you will experience a "DREAMING CONCERT."  An interactive technique created to help you full remember your dreams:

In Love

In Career

In Family 

In Travel

And more

Are you ready to open the box and find the energy you need to accelerate your life? Come and RSVP today to open your FULL ACHIEVEMENT ENERGY by unboxing your dreams.

Wednesday January 13

turn right then left to the end of the hall

At Door RATE is $25.00

MATERIALS fee included! We use materials because we are always doing active processes based on brain and cognitive dynamics. WE USE STUFF TO MAKE SURE YOU GET RESULTS.


Each group session Rule: "What You Learn Today You Can Use Today"

New members at some point start scrabbling to find pen and paper because they show up with an expectation the session is a sale pitch for something else. When "First timers"discover there is a NEW system of knowledge based on new tools, processes and understanding they start asking "do you have a pen and paper I can borrow?" Each session you always learn something you can use walking out the door.

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, January 6th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The January session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (January 6th - 27th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (January 6th - 27th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (January 5th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor & make a left. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.
results.name: Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino Classes!

results.description:
Dancing is so much fun, I really feel alive when I am dancing Salsa! You should go out and have some fun! Go out and meet some new friends! 


Please join us for another fun dance class for beginners, a one hour fun networking event, an easy to follow dance class taught by an experienced dance instructor.  We will be dancing non-stop, hope you will enjoy burning away all the calories while having fun. 

You will learn a repeated sequence of dance moves, after this class you will be able to dance non-stop with your friends in the city. 

Dancing is a good workout, it may "improve your health and give you more energy". We will rotate dance partners every five minutes, so that each person will make many new friends during this fun networking event.

This is a quality one hour fun salsa lesson for beginners, we put in extra efforts to make this a fun event by making the dance moves very easy to follow for beginners. We have taught this class many times over the past 4 years.

The best and really nice Salsa music will be playing on the high quality BOSE sound system, over the last 5 years we have created a collection of 1000 Salsa songs. 

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$ 
The cost per person for this fun Salsa class is: 
$15, when paid early online. 
or $20 when paid during the event. 
If the event gets full, then this option becomes unavailable.

James

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description: David Haddad, Executive Director of Open mHealth, will join us to talk about the challenges in making health data easy to consume and share via a common API for devices, and the methods his company has used to address those challenges.
results.name: Opening Up Health Data

results.description:
As seen on NY1 News and more! This is a singles gaming trivia Meetup. You are partnered into teams of 3-5 and get to work as a team to answer trivia questions. 

*THIS MEETUP SELLS OUT EVERY TIME, SO IF YOU LIKE TO ATTEND RSVP & GET TICKETS ASAP, ESPECIALLY WOMEN - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Jan-13-2016_at_0700PM

Trivia is a perfect "non-pressure" activity where you can gauge as to how smart, attractive, creative and collaborative your "teammates" are and perhaps find a potential future "mate". 

The winning team each round receives a FREE round of shots! After each round, we'll switch up teams so you get to meet the majority of singles in attendance.

What to expect:

• Complimentary Appetizers

• All-Night Drink Specials

• Free round of shots for the winning team after each round

• Overall men & women's trivia champ receives a free round

 *50% off tix for group members ($15 - regular price $30)

*MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Jan-13-2016_at_0700PM

RSVPing alone will not get you into this event. You must also purchase a ticket in advance.  (Tickets will NOT be sold at door). This non-ethnic specific and will be mostly 20s-40s.

Multiple Meetup groups are promoting this event so don't just go by the RSVPs you see here. We'll have up to 50 members attending - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Jan-13-2016_at_0700PM

results.description:
To CJK Experts and Native Speakers:

We practice like this (including, but not limited to):

Session 1 (7pm-8pm): Interpretation methods practice

For example, words, phrases or sentences interpretation, target language repeating, shadowing and summarization, etc.

We set two tables to practice Chinese and Korean separately (Japanese is on hiatus due to low membership). The session is basically for intermediate & above Chinese and Korean learners.

Session 2 (8pm-9pm): Topic-based speaking practice

Summary, speak or discuss the topic you are provided or you have prepared by your target language (Chinese & Korean).

Also, everybody can move to any table as they want.

If you would like to practice English, please join our regular Saturday meetup generously hosted by Carl.

Looking forward to practicing with you all!

Organizers
results.name: Regular Interpretation & Speaking CJK Practice

results.description:
Learning English? Want to make your pronunciation better?
Join for a small group lesson with an English teacher!

Class Part 1: 7pm-8pm
-Small group lesson, max 12 people
-Common American English Idioms, Idiomatic Phrases, and other Figures of Speech, from Metro and AMNY newspapers
-Pronunciation practice
-Group discussion

Class Part 2: 8pm-9pm
Open conversation practice with other students & Native English speakers


It is $10 to attend the class. There are only 12 spots, so please be serious about attending if you sign up. You will be removed from this group if you signed up for event and fail to attend

Bring a notebook, questions & a pen!
results.name: English CLASS* Practice, Pronunciation and idioms

results.description:
Exploring Beyond Maps: Applying Today's Mapping Tools To Chart Tomorrow's Universe - a Data Viz Journey From City To Outer Space.

This event is offered as part of our successful Data: Now We're Talking series — an evening of presentation and conversation with a team from CartoDB that exemplifies the best of NYC data science, each individual dedicated to challenging the frontiers of current possibility within the fields of map-making, visualization and analytics.


We'll be exposed to the latest ideas and some dazzling displays that sweep the canvas from the realms of wonder apparent within the built environment to the unlimited expanse of Outer Space.


At the intersection of geospace, physics and data, the CartoDB team will explain which development tools are currently available to us in our visualizations of location and time, and how to manipulate them artfully for enhanced understanding of our future place in an infinite universe. 

The team members at CartoDB hold different and sometimes conflicting perspectives, their debate promises to be lively and informative. This is a real possibility to learn in the most entertaining of ways. And that’s our aim for all NYTBG events.

We hope whether you’re a Programmer or a Data Scientist, a UX Designer or a Product Manager, that you’ll come out in full force for this very special evening at CartoDB's cool new office space. It's a world of fun out there.


@andrewxhill

Andrew Hill is CartoDB’s Chief Science Officer and the creator of some far-out maps. He holds a PhD from the University of Colorado where he led research on the ways automated data pipelines can be used to generate insights within the sphere of biodiversity sciences. His cross-disciplinary work merged the natural sciences with data science and engineering. Andrew is an educator: an Assistant Professor, a board member of a citizen science non-profit, and an external advisor to a graduate program for mapping and cartography. 


@Stuart_Lynn

Stuart Lynn is a map scientist. Armed with a degree in mathematical physics from Edinburgh University he decided astronomy was prettier, in fact, easier to explain in bars, and he went on to obtain a Ph.D. in astrophysics. He currently works at the Adler Planetarium as the technical lead of the Zooniverse: the largest collection of online citizen science projects. Stuart is passionate about encouraging everyone to participate in the world of real science, motivating them to go out and make meaningful discoveries on their own.


@namessanti

Santiago Giraldo is a creative design professional with a passion for complex data science, cartographic design and information visualization. An expert in current technologies and the future of cities, his work at Parsons in Urban Systems Design & Ecologies typifies the enormous potential brought about by the convergence of technology and design: the creation of new knowledge through the telling of important stories. 

CartoDB is a NYC Tech success story. We’re fortunate to have the team host our event and to hear them share their expertise with such enthusiasm.
results.name: Exploring Beyond Maps. A Data Viz Journey from City to Outer Space.

results.description:
The concept of chakra originates in Hindu texts and features in tantric and yogic traditions of Hinduism and Buddhism. Its name derives from the Sanskrit word for "wheel" or "turning" (cakraṃ चक्रं [ˈtʃəkrə̃], pronounced [ˈtʃəkrə] in Hindi; Pali: cakka चक्क, Thai: จักระ, Telugu: చక్రo, Tamil: சக்கரம், Kannada: ಚಕ್ರ, Chinese: 轮, Tibetan: འཁོར་ལོ་; khorlo).[1]

The chakras are believed to be a number of wheel-like vortices which, according to traditional Indian medicine, exist in the surface of the subtle body of living beings.[2] The chakras are said to be "force centers" or whorls of energy permeating, from a point on the physical body, the layers of the subtle bodies in an ever-increasing fan-shaped formation. Rotating vortices of subtle matter, they are considered focal points for the reception and transmission of energies.[3] Different belief systems posit a varying number of chakras; the best-known system in the West has seven chakras.

results.description:
SESSION 1: UNBOXING YOUR DREAMS FOR MORE ENERGY

What could you get done with more ENERGY?

 It seems like "goal setting" is the magic key to everything in both business and life. "Goal setting" NEEDS an EXTRA KICK to move your life forward. You need to go BEYOND goal setting. What's missing? Start with your DREAMS before "IMAGING" the specific goals you desire. The EXTRA-ENERGY to work on NEW goals while still handling daily life is the missing piece. Your goals need emotional energy to work. Where to find more energy?

The amount of energy you can tap is not fixed!

The starting line for health,happiness and life focus is energy. Where can you possibly find more energy? You already eat healthy and exercise regularly. We feel rushed all the time and lose touch with our dreams. Because of stress overload from the rapid pace of modern life our dreams become boxed up inside of our heads. Everyone loves the experience of UNBOXING a new toy. We even love watching others UNBOXING their new toys on YouTube. There is an excitement and adventure about what's possible with a new toy. Have you fully unboxed your dreams? You won't have full energy until you have unboxed your dreams. Dream energy when unboxed provides a wellspring of emotional energy to push you further to get more done.

RSVP Now

Fully unboxed dreams turn up the temperature in your life. Becoming clear about your dreams is not only a renewing experience that feels like a mini vacation. Suddenly, you have MORE energy to handle and do more during your day. Within the cognitive environment of your UNBOXED DREAMS problems at work and home become small stuff. During session 1 you will unbox multiple dreams within the important areas of your life while connecting them together. With "Dream connectivity" you create a psychological pool of unlimited energy to continually recharge yourself.

Put More Energy Into Your Week

Find Out What Organically Motivates You

Gain A Method To Mentally Release Worry And Anxiety 

Make The Process of Figuring Out Your goal-What You Really Want clearer

Click This Discount Link To RSVP -$25.00 At Door

How Do We Unbox Your Dreams?

Dreams are the BIG aspirations that we long towards. Our dreams are A powerful mixture of both fact and fantasy. During Session 1 you will experience a "DREAMING CONCERT."  An interactive technique created to help you full remember your dreams:

In Love

In Career

In Family 

In Travel

And more

Are you ready to open the box and find the energy you need to accelerate your life? Come and RSVP today to open your FULL ACHIEVEMENT ENERGY by unboxing your dreams.

LOCATION:

SESSION 1: UNBOXING YOUR DREAMS FOR MORE ENERGY

Wednesday January 13

Time 7:00 pm To 10:00

Location: Ripley-Grier 

520 8th Avenue 17 FL 

Between 36th and 37th street 

New York, NY 10018 

Please be on time, allow for traffic and delays in your travel plans.

Take the Right Hand side elevator to the 17 Floor

Walk though the glass doors and turn left and at the end 

turn right then left to the end of the hall

NOTE: If there is a ROOM CHANGE consult the front desk.

Room: 17 M

When you RSVP NOW Online Discount rate is $19.95

At Door RATE is $25.00

MATERIALS fee included! We use materials because we are always doing active processes based on brain and cognitive dynamics. WE USE STUFF TO MAKE SURE YOU GET RESULTS.


Each group session Rule: "What You Learn Today You Can Use Today"

New members at some point start scrabbling to find pen and paper because they show up with an expectation the session is a sale pitch for something else. When "First timers"discover there is a NEW system of knowledge based on new tools, processes and understanding they start asking "do you have a pen and paper I can borrow?" Each session you always learn something you can use walking out the door.

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.

Whatever you love, somebody is making a living doing that very thing. Entrepreneurship is the wave of  the future. You can learn to earn your living by living your dream. What To Do With Your Life is a coaching experience designed to assist you in finding the pieces of your life puzzle and then putting them together to design the career and lifestyle that fits you. As the jobs continue to disappear, you will be one of those fortunate people who has the tools to build your own future.

Every person has something that they can do supremely well, the thing they were born to do. If you find your vital function, and create the support system that allows you to perform that function freely, you can earn a good living, because you will be delivering tangible value to your fellow human beings. But, most people have lost touch with what they love, and have given up hope of reaching that kind of fulfillment.

We can't wait to meet you at our next event! Thank you.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:00 to 8:30 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. results.description:
Note the later time! 

We'll meet in front of MP Taverna for a loop run along Buckout St to Mercy College, through Dobbs Ferry and back. Afterward, everyone is welcome to stop in at MP Taverna for drinks and/or eats.

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the parking lot in front of MP Taverna. We'll head south on Buckout St and Half Moon Lane and then we'll use the little wooded short cut to the Ardsley Train Station. We'll run past the station, veer right onto the lit walking path into the Mercy College campus, and through the campus, exiting on to Broadway at Landing Dr. We'll head south on Broadway and then we'll weave through Ardsley Park, taking Langdon to Belmont to Field Terrace to Osceola, before exiting right onto Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: MP Taverna parking lot (One Bridge St, Irvington, NY)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Dobbs Ferry Loop

If you wish to bring equipment such as a camera etc. to show or to ask questions about, please feel free to bring them also. 

THIS MEETUP IS FREE!

THERE IS NO REQUIREMENT TO PURCHASE FOOD OR DRINK.

If people wish to stay longer, I'm usually willing to also.

results.description: Africa. From safaris to rugged overland trips, the continent has a lot of connotations for travelers, from beginner to expert. If you're nervous about pulling out the stops and traveling to Africa, join HI-Boston for a special, comprehensive workshop on how you can solo backpack through eastern and southern Africa. Our presenter, HI-Boston's own Paul Kuhne, traveled through Tanzania, Malawi, Zambia, and South Africa earlier this year, with pit stops in Botswana and Zimbabwe, over the course of seven weeks. He'll dispel myths and misconceptions about African travel, and provide practiced tips and tricks to ensure a safe and fun journey. From safety to budgeting, Paul will walk you through his own process of planning a solo trip, and show you why you should keep Africa in your future travel plans. See you there at the Soho REI!
results.name: Learn How to Solo Backpack Africa

results.description:
Happy New Year Ladies!

Are you looking to take the Security+ exam?

Let's study together!

This is a peer to peer, study session, with Q&A using authorized CompTIA Study Guides to assist attendees in preparation for the SY0-401 exam.

COST: Free

Location: Remote

TIME: Wednesdays: 7:00-9:00PM EST

Registration: Please register with the Security+ Study Group on WSC's site: http://womenscyberjutsu.site-ym.com/members/group_select.asp?type=17741

For our online study experience, we use JOIN.ME as the online communication tool. For the best JOIN.ME experience please wear a headset with a microphone so that we will all be able to hear each other talk, read aloud and discuss answers. However, if anyone wishes to remain microphone-free, that’s AOK. For first-time users of JOIN.ME, you will have to download the JOIN.ME desktop client first - if you don't already have it - and you will be prompted to download it when you click on the above link. Just follow the online instructions.

If you have any questions please contact me at: [masked].

Give your Info Sec Career the boost it needs for 2016!

See you Wednesday!

Pamela Dean

==================================
The Six Core Books of Knowledge for the SEC+ Exam:

1.0 Network Security 20%

2.0 Compliance and Operational Security 18%

3.0 Threats and Vulnerabilities 20%

4.0 Application, Data and Host Security 15%

5.0 Access Control and Identity Management 15%

6.0 Cryptography 12%

DATING & MARRIAGE WORKSHOP
Successful dating relationships and marriages don’t come easy, but we are convinced that they ARE within reach. Gather for an exciting evening of food and refreshments, new friends, fun and honest discussion from a faith-based perspective, and a ultra-transparent lecture. We will discover many of the following relationship strategies, including:

• The Non-Negotiable Things to Work Through During Your Engagement

• The 4 Personality Types & How Yours Will Effect Your

• Marriage (w/ Personality Test) 

• The 5 Love Languages (w/ Love Language Test) 

• Your Familial Upbringing & Its Effect on Your Marital Expectations 

• Healthy Communication Strategies & Conflict Management 

• Big Forgiveness & Its Contribution to Relational Longevity 

• Love vs. Emotion vs. Lust 

• Teamwork & Clarifying Roles & Responsibilities 

• The Concept of Unconditional Love 

• Trust & Faithfulness: the Foundation for Sexual Intimacy

Whether you’re already MARRIED or are SINGLE and thinking about tying the knot at some point in the future, leave this event feeling more equipped to create a marriage that lasts. Invite your significant other and/or friends to join you!

AFTER PARTY
After the workshop, all are welcome to hang out and network with friends and enjoy the music and refreshments.

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

Hello,

We hope this email finds you well and healthy on this Holiday Season.


Our January keynote speaker is:


Dr Sachin Patel CEO and Founder of 'The Living Proof Institute" is a proud father, husband and chiropractic physician.  He serves his community as a Functional and Lifestyle Medicine Provider, speaker and author.  He enjoys working with motivated patients that are looking to elevate their health by combining personal responsibility with his clinical expertise. 


Dr. Patel uses easy to follow analogies to give interesting insight into your health.  By having a better understanding of how your body works you can have a much greater impact on your personal health outcomes.  By helping you make better personal decisions you can literally transform your life overnight.  The benefits of this knowledge will pay dividends for a lifetime.

We are looking forward to be with you.

results.description:
The Appalachian Mountain Clubs New York-North Jersey Chapter is bringing the 2015 Reel Paddling Film Festival to the Symphony Space in NYC!

PURCHASE TICKETS AT: https://tickets.symphonyspace.org/public/auto_choose_ga.asp?area=11

The 10th annual Reel Paddling Film Festival showcases the world's best paddling films to audiences in Canada, United States and around the world. The festival inspires more people to explore rivers, lakes and oceans, push physical and emotional extremes, embrace the lifestyle and appreciate the heritage of the wild places we paddle.

The Reel Paddling Film Festival is a film contest awarding winning films in 10 categories. The winners and other shortlisted films are then toured to more than 100 cities around the world, screening for an audience of more than 30,000 outdoor adventure enthusiasts and their friends and families.

If you would like to learn more about The Reel Paddling Film Festical please visit them at: www.reelpaddlingfilmfestival.com

Learn more about the AMC at www.outdoors.org and the New York-North Jersey Chapter at www.amc-ny.org

results.description:
Though we often regard love and compassion as limited qualities, of which we hardly have enough to extend to ourselves and our families, these states can be developed and expanded with practice and effort. In fact, each of us has a boundless capacity for kindness and understanding, which we can apply to all of our relationships -- to ourselves, our family and friends, people we don’t know, and even those we don’t like. 

Creating a Compassionate World is a six-week class which combines western psychological techniques with traditional lovingkindness meditation to develop our limitless capacity for beneficial and wise action.


No pre-registration is needed.  Chairs will be provided. Note we are located on the second floor of a walk-up building.  There is no elevator.


Details and registration: http://theidproject.org/events/2016/01/06/creating-compassionate-world-nyc-online
results.name: Learn Lovingkindness Meditation - Paid Event

There's a chance that this is designed to be an audio-based round, depending on if it repeats next week. • Current Events: 4 questions, 5 pts each • Final Round: 2 questions, each wagered between 0-12 Parking options include street parking (which seems to be free after 7pm), lot parking ($1?) and garage parking. results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]

PS: the small gym is located on the 5th floor, go through the big gym to the back.

results.description:
Hi all! First meetup of 2016 woo hoo! Let's read Me Before You by JoJo Moyes (thanks Kate!)... "They had nothing in common until love gave them everything to lose . . .

Louisa Clark is an ordinary girl living an exceedingly ordinary life—steady boyfriend, close family—who has barely been farther afield than their tiny village. She takes a badly needed job working for ex–Master of the Universe Will Traynor, who is wheelchair bound after an accident. Will has always lived a huge life—big deals, extreme sports, worldwide travel—and now he’s pretty sure he cannot live the way he is.

Will is acerbic, moody, bossy—but Lou refuses to treat him with kid gloves, and soon his happiness means more to her than she expected. When she learns that Will has shocking plans of his own, she sets out to show him that life is still worth living.

A Love Story for this generation, Me Before You brings to life two people who couldn’t have less in common—a heartbreakingly romantic novel that asks, What do you do when making the person you love happy also means breaking your own heart?"
results.name: January Meetup (Me Before You)

results.description:
Ladies and Gents,

Due to popular demand from the Free classes attendees, I am happy to announce that I will be teaching a formal progressive Salsa Dancing class for beginners every week, starting this Wednesday the 13th. This means that you will get progressively better each week and advance your dancing step by step in a no-rush, no-nonsense, and friendly environment. No need to bring a partner. Dancing is a social and physical activity that provides enjoyment, exercise, stress release, fun, agility, creative outlet, and so much more.

Time: Wednesdays - 7:30 - 9pm - Try being there 10 minutes earlier if you are able

Fee: $15 per class (1 hour and a half duration). You do not pay for all 12 weeks together. You pay when u take a class and only for that class. 

Address: 500 Eighth Avenue, New York, NY 10018 (btwn 35th street and 36th street). Two blocks away from A/E trains

Room: 1203 (this room can change from week to week, just ask info desk for Silvio's class or look at the board)

Dancing Level: Beginner (you do not know much or nothing at all)

Attire: Any, but I recommend Casual or Gym-like attire.

Recommended Shoes: Bring dance shoes or shoes that let you move freely and do not slip out.

This is a progressive class, meaning that every class will introduce you to the next material while at the same time review the material from all previous classes. You will never forget, get plenty of practice, and you can catch up easily in case u missed a class. This will make you grow as a dancer much faster. This Beginner class will progress along through 12 weeks. When that is over, another 12 week period will begin. You do not pay for all 12 weeks together. You pay when u take a class and only for that class. The idea is for you guys to have the convenient choice of learn to dance salsa on wednesday and then go to dance and practice your new moves on Fridays at La fama with dancers that are at same level. Also, since I will be at La Fama, I will be open to answer questions. Those who missed a wednesday class can catch up on Friday with the help of your fellow students.

The class fee will be $15 and the class duration will be 1 hour and a half. To put this in perspective for those who aren't aware, a typical salsa class will cost you $20 for 1 hour. As of right now, classes will be on Wednesdays from 7:30pm to 9pm in Pearl Studios, which is located between 35th and 36th and 8 avenue in Manhattan.

Here is a preview tentative syllabus for the first 6 weeks out of the 12:

During each week, the following concepts will be taught along with the material when necessary:

(Posture) (Weight Shifting) (hand rotation) (spotting) (pacing) (balance) (distance control) (musicality) (etc)

Week 1 (Jan 13th)

Footwork: Basic Step, Basic variations, upper body movement, Body isolations and coordination exercises, Timing, Music

Partnerwork: Open Hold, Close Hold, Hand placements, Correct Frame, Correct Tension

Week 2 (Jan 20th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Right-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Leading The right-turn, Following the right-turn

Week 3 (Jan 27th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Left-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Cross-Body-Lead and Follow.

Week 4 (Feb 3rd)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 1 and 2 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Cross-body-Lead combined with Inside Turn, Turn Combinations

Week 5 (Feb 10th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 3 and 4 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Open-Break Step

Week 6 (Feb 17th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 5 and 6 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Walk-Around Turn

Let me explain how this came about. The free classes I normally offer at salsa socials and lounges always teach the basic step and a single turn due to the fact that there are always new people who have never done salsa before. So if you attend every week, you will always get the same material. Those classes are meant to warm up the party and allow people to interact and be introduced to the dance. I do my best to be very detailed and give you the best instruction and it makes me happy when almost everyone in every class learns the basics in just 1 hour. This has motivated people to want to learn more and I usually get 3/5 requests for formal classes every week. So I am happy to announce that you will get your wish :) Hope to see you guys there.
results.name: Progressive Salsa Class for Beginners

group.name: LA FAMA - Active Salsa Dancing Group - Free Classes

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

Learn to use your innate power

DOES LIFE HAVE MEANING? Why are so many people suffering? What happens to us when we die? Where did we come from? Authentic Kabbalah was made to answer these and all of life’s deepest questions. Take a tour of the laws shaping your life. Discover insights the ancient Kabbalists had into nature’s program and the purpose behind it. In this two hour lecture, we’re going to debunk the many myths surrounding Kabbalah, answer your questions, and explain how you can take the first step into the path of spiritual attainment using Kabbalah’s most practical methodology.

http://www.kabbalah.info/bb/lecture/?utm_source=newyorksuggestameetup&utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=introlecturejan2016

--
ABOUT BNEI BARUCH
Bnei Baruch is an educational organization dedicated to sharing the authentic wisdom of Kabbalah with all people regardless of nationality, gender or cultural background,
according to the method of Baal HaSulam.
results.name: WHAT IS LIFE? Free introductory lecture to authentic Kabbalah

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!
results.name: Weekly Climbing Meetup - New members climb for free!!

group.name: The New York Metro Rock Climbing Meetup

results.description:
Open Scrimmages

How To Sign-Up As An Individual (Without a Team)

Come to one of Big City's Open Scrimmage Nights listed below - prepared to play - as teams will be formed out of players at the same skill level. You’ll spend a couple of hours playing volleyball and meeting people, and by the end of the evening, you’ll be on a team!


No need to RSVP just show up, there will be plenty of people attending!!!


Look below to see which Scrimmage Night to attend.


BRING YOUR CHECKBOOK - you must pay that evening in order to be placed on a team. Teams will consist of 10 players, each of whom will pay $135 for the full 10-week season.

General Open Scrimmages (under 5 yrs. of league experience)

Tuesday January 12th 7:30pm-10pm

Advanced Open Scrimmage (5+ yrs. competitive experience)

Wednesday January 13th, 7:30pm-10pm

Click here for more Information

LOCATION
HIGH SCHOOL FOR ENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES
444 W. 56th St., between. 9th & 10th Aves.

(Accessible via 57th St. cross town bus, or take subway to Columbus Circle)

NOTE: To enter the school, you must have a valid photo I.D.

If you cannot arrive at the evening's start time, just get there as soon as you can. There are facilities for changing at the school.

And lastly, please be aware that children under 16 are not permitted in any of our gyms (due to insurance regulations).

For more info visit bigcityvolleyball.com
results.name: Big City Volleyball Co-Ed Indoor Winter 2016 Advanced Open Scrimmage!

results.description:
Experience a Spiritual Tool
That Can Help Transform Your Life!

No matter what your spiritual background or faith, you are invited to learn a simple technique that can help transform your life. Join us and others in your community to experience spiritual insights gained by singing HU—a love song to God.

Singing HU can:
• Expand your awareness
• Help you release mental and emotional stresses
• Heal a broken heart
• Offer solace during times of grief
• Help you experience divine love


We sing HU together for about 20 minutes followed by five minutes of quiet contemplation. Light refreshment and conversation follow. Please join us—your friends and family are invited, too. We hope to see you there.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvecTKM_-wk

For more information about HU check out www.HearHU.org. For information on other events being held throughout the state, visit www.eckankar-nj.org.


Every Second Wednesday,  7:30 – 8:30 pm

ECKANKAR Center
11 Park Street, Montclair, NJ
There is on-street parking and two municipal parking lots in the area. Please pay particular attention to meters and parking signs. (Metered parking is free evenings after 7pm and on Sundays.)

Presented by the Satsang Society of New Jersey, Inc., a Chartered Affiliate of ECKANKAR, Religion of the Light and Sound of God and hosted by the Center for Spiritual Living North Jersey.

The terms ECKANKAR, ECK, EK, MAHANTA, SOUL TRAVEL and VAIRAGI, among others are trademarks of ECKANKAR. Copyright ©2012 ECKANKAR. All rights reserved. ECKANKAR PO Box 2000, Chanhassen, MN[masked] USA. Visit Eckankar’s Web site at www.eckankar.org.
results.how_to_find_us: Located north of Bloomfield Ave, right next to the municipal parking deck, next to the YMCA. Enter the glass door to the left of Villa Victoria Pizzeria and go upstairs to our room on the 2nd floor, directly across from the stairs.
results.name: Community HU Song

results.description:
Inward Bound: Life as a Spiritual Adventure

When things like work, family, wealth or relationships fail to deliver satisfaction, or leave us filled with uncertainty and pain, it is time to seek happiness from a different source.  Meditation can help us discover stillness within and reconnect with our deeper goals.  By learning to meditate on the stages of the path to enlightenment, our life becomes an inner expedition to greater meaning, fulfillment and purpose.

$15.00 Suggested donation. No one turned away for lack of funds.
results.how_to_find_us: Meditatenj.org
results.name: Inward Bound: Life as a Spiritual Adventure

results.description:
Join us, as we explore the basis of Meditation & Self-knowledge, Mysticism, Kabbalah, Esotericism, Astral Projection, Sacred Sexuality, Alchemy, and the mysteries of The human Consciousness. 

Every Wednesday Night at 7:30pm. (Rsvp required)

Topics to study:


- Introduction to Gnosis: The term "Gnosis" & it's foundations; Science, Philosophy, Art and Mysticism.

- Foundations of Gnostic Psychology: The Consciousness, The Personality & the Ego. The Human Machine & the 3 Brains. The human mind & the Universal Mind.

- The Awakening of the Consciousness: Mindfulness, Self-observation & The fourth dimension. Lucid Dreams & The Astral World.

- Universal Laws and the Ray of Death: Return, Recurrence, and Reincarnation. Law of Karma and Dharma. The Mysteries of Life and Death. Evolution, Involution, and Revolution.

*** Guided Meditation for beginners and intermediate levels after every lecture***

"The mission of Gnosticism in this age is provide the methods and tools to rescue the highest values of the human being in order to pursue transcendence and the self-realization of the Being." Samael Aun Weor
results.name: Introduction to Gnosis (Wednesdays Nights)

results.description:
We're having a Beyond the Photograph Photo Club Party to kick off the New Year! The party will be on Wednesday, January 13, at 7:30 pm. The location is noted in the MeetUp.


Jen has graciously offered to host at her place for the event. This will be a pot-luck style party, so bring some food and/or drinks! Call it a light supper - bring finger food a little more substantive than potato chips :) Or bring libations.


We'll be brainstorming ideas for what we want to accomplish with the photo club this year, including photo shoots, meetings, workshops, and much more. So in addition to bringing food, bring some ideas as well.

We also need to make sure that we contribute to the maintenance of the MeetUp, so if you'd like to chip in, here's a perfect chance to do so!

But mostly, we'll be here to enjoy good food, good company, and come up with good ideas for the year! If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.
results.name: Beyond the Photograph Photo Club Party

results.description:
Wednesday night Baladi Beat Belly Dance with Tarik Sultan, new time, new room!

You don't need a choreography! Dare to be different! Even a dead fish can go with the flow! LET'S DANCE!

In this class you will learn how to dance like a natural and unlock your inner beauty! You will learn how to respond to the music in a way that allows you to express your emotions through movement. Other added benifits: Increase your muscle tone, stamina, coordination, posture. Releive stress and tension all while have fun and looking great!

All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, we don't make cookie cutter dancers, we make individuals! Dare to be stand out from the crowd! Dare to be one of a kind! Dare to be YOU!

Classes meet every Wednesday 7:30pm to 8:30pm in room 3A

$25 a single class, $50 for 3 classes, $65 for 4.

Cash or check made out to "Tarik Sultan". Check out the website at www.tariksultan.net/Class_Schedule.html

For more information call[masked] or email at [masked]

results.description:
First, we've moved to a more convenient home! Our next meetup will be at Sailthru, 160 Varick Street, 12th floor. S/o to our own Johnson Wang for hooking that up!

To learn what "Responsive Career Design" means in full, please read the deck from the last meetup. Deliberate career design can make people more productive, happier, and more successful—and it's the key to succeeding at the best companies to work for. In the future, the most fulfilling roles will only be available to people who know how to operate autonomously inside a new kind of self-organizing entity.

I first became interested in org design after writing this 8,000-word piece about Github for Fast Company. Since then, I've learned that many of the individuals at companies like Github have "org" strategies for their personal and creative lives, too.


As always, email me if you have questions ([masked]) and see you soon!

results.description:
A Shamanic journey is a method of exploring the spiritual universe in a trance-like meditative state, for the purpose of connecting with our guardian spirits, recover energy and wisdom that has been lost, and discover more about ourselves and our souls purpose.

As we listen to the heartbeat of the drum, we will embark on a journey to meet our spirit and animal guides. They will share their wisdom teachings, healing energy and loving support, all gifts that we are able to bring back with us.

Following the journey there will be a brief sharing and discussion.

Come rehearsal with us at our regular location, the Music Conservatory of Westchester! No need to prepare, just show up with your instrument and get ready to play. We have around 30-40 people at most rehearsals (most members are not on the Meetup page) so don't worry, you will have a full orchestra to play with.

RSVP on Meetup to let us know you're coming, or email [masked].

Parking: The Conservatory asks that orchestra musicians *not* park in the Conservatory parking lot unless you are a tuition paying student of either the Conservatory of the Steffi Nossen School of Dance. Street parking is free after 6pm, and there is a large municipal lot across Central Ave from City Limits (24hr meters in the lot).

The first rehearsal is free. Subsequent rehearsals are $10/rehearsal or a discounted annual rate.

results.description:
Join us while we watch the THINK tank with teeth!!


This is our monthly small group networking/ socializing event. It has been our most popular and fun event. Network in a way that makes a real impression. Meet, interact, and discuss business issues with the people you are networking with.


Many entrepreneurs love to watch Shark Tank on TV to see the rich Sharks pound away at the ideas of various business founders. What wisdom does the Shark Tank impart? Some of the best shows are the follow ups where businesses the Sharks rejected go on to success anyway. Let's get together to watch some episodes over some food & drink and discuss the show afterwards.

And do you know who the MegaShark is that wins every single episode with every single deal?


The event will be held at Stone Creek Lounge which has a great menu with reasonable prices. So come on down!
results.name: Shark Tank Showdown!!!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this event? visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: Intimacy and Communication Games - TurnON NYC!

group.name: Greater NYC and Long Island Over 40 and Ready For Fun

venue.address_1: 257 West 39th St. 14th Floor (Check the white board for "Steve" or ask the front desk)
venue.name: Champion Studios

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Wednesday Improv Scenework Class 8-10pm ($10)

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
Join us for our Digital Camera Workshop! There are a few spaces left so be quick! Seminar Digital Camera: Jan 13, Wednesday 8:15 PM-10:15 PM.


Each settings on your camera provides a world of potential for bettering your images. Whether you use a DSLR or a point and shoot, there are tons of tricks that you may be missing out on. We'll explore settings such as exposure compensation and various presets that can turn a regular image into a special one. Our knowledgeable instructors will guide you through all the main options that your camera has, and how and when to apply each of them based on the effect and scene that you are looking to portray.


Additionally, this class will thoroughly introduce to all other digital photography related topics that you will need to know when making your next camera purchase. These subjects include, megapixels, lenses, noise, white balance, ISO, SD cards and much more. Never miss that shot again! Join us and learn to maximize your camera's potential to match with your creative skills. Requirements: Digital camera (SLR or Point and shoot). No prior knowledge required.

Everyone is welcome!

Desserts is not always about baking, frozen, or refrigerated, what we do here is to mix and match with daily fresh ingredients. Forch of Nature Music Group proudly presents: "The Shed".

The Shed is a monthly jam session catering to New York City's hottest Hip Hop, Soul and Jazz musicians. The showcase is a platform for progressive music as well as a place for artist to build their chops. While occasionally heating the stage themselves, The Shed's hosts Anu~Sun, Augi and Bria Monèt will introduce you to some of New York's finest underground talent and surprise guests.

To learn more about The Shed, visit them on Instagram: www.instagram.com/theshedopenjam

Below is a music vibe example of The Shed house band when they were at Tammany Hall earlier this year, led by HarlemGo Meetup member Anu The Giant, however all genre of music is welcome to come share their talent.

http://youtu.be/Rg3PmE6dAAQ

Past Performances at #TheShed Include:

Robert Glasper, James Poysner (of The Roots), Mark Kelley (of The Roots), Raymond Angry (of The Roots), RC and The Gritz (Erykah Badu’s backing band), Big Yuki, Marcus Strickland, Jaleel Shaw, Jerimiah Abiah

Our Meetup

Daniel will be downstairs in Silvana at 9:00pm to hold seats for group members attending. Showtime starts around 9:30pm and goes to midnight. If you are interested in performing this evening, be sure to arrive early (between 9:30-10:00pm) and sign-up on the performing list at the venue. As always, if there are any questions, you're running late, etc. feel free to reach him at 774.275.3646.

Directions of Silvana:

Silvana is located at 300 W 116th St., between Frederick Douglass Blvd. (8th Ave.) and Manhattan Ave. in Central Harlem. The closest subway stop is the B & C local train lines to the 116th Street station. Nearby bus lines include the M10, M7, & M3.

results.description:
This is a very special show. Sinne Egg is an award winning singer from Denmark. Listen to her online- Wonderful!

But here's the deal.... this show is going to be sold out. Gino is giving us just 8 seats. Only RSVP if you KNOW you will attend. I will allow a waiting list in case any more seats open up. AND...you must RSVP by January 11th.

Sinne Eeg is one of the strongest new female vocalists from the Scandinavian jazz scene. With 5 albums Sinne Eeg has established herself as a Danish jazz singer with international potential. Sinne’s distinctive vocals have earned her a loyal and ever growing fan base around the world as well as in her native country. As a singer she is influenced by Nancy Wilson, Betty Carter and Sarah Vaughan, but with her personal touch of soft darkness, Sinne keeps the Scandinavian melancholy settled in her music. 

Eeg has an amazing technique, coverage for all the tones she sings, a genuine jazz feeeling and an unusually large vocal range from top to bottom. Coupled with a totally obvious stage charisma, dignity and a sparkle in the eye, this really makes you surrender."(Review of Sinne Eeg + trio at Kristianstad Jazzfestival 10 Oct 2008 by Alexander Agrell, jazz journalist at Sydsvenskan (leading morning paper of South Sweden)

As ususal the Kitano is a $15 cover and a $20 minimum.
results.name: SINNE EEG QUARTET- Special Kitano show!

Kent Street pitch, Bushwick inlet park

Show up early and you are good.
