Explore electronics, coding, and creative technology at our monthly Micro-controller night. We talk about Arduinos, Raspberry Pis, and the other tiny devices we love to use for embedded projects. A laptop with a usb port is recommended in case you want to get hands on with any of the devices.

This event is free for everyone. Please bring a computer with a USB port, ideally bring one or more micro-controllers that you want to work with, or at least a project idea. Please share your ideas in the comments below to inspire others.

Boards are available online, or PM the organizer and they can either get one for you or tell you where they're cheapest online.

MakerBar volunteers will be present to help you with your electronics project or work on their own.

You're welcome to come hack on whatever you'd like, even if it's totally unrelated to electronics entirely. There will be plenty of awesome hackers from our community for you to meet.

The Microcontroller Special Interest Group runs on the second Wednesday every month.


[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

results.description:
NightShul is for everyone in Brooklyn’s progressive Jewish Community (nightshul.org for more information and to sign up). You don’t have to belong to a synagogue. You don’t have to believe any specific thing, pray in any particular way, or profess any particular political persuasion. It’s for young adults, seniors and everybody in between, in every generational cohort. 

It’s a Jewish learning community, but you don’t have to be Jewish to love learning. We welcome those who are curious and open-minded. We especially welcome people whose significant other is Jewish and who want to know more of what it’s about.


Come be part of this growing community, make friends, learn and have fun. Each evening begins with a wine and cheese hour at 7:00pm, and the learning begins at 8:00pm. Located at the East Midwood Jewish Center, 1625 Ocean Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11230.

Meetup will continue weekly on Thursday evenings through January 28.

SEE NIGHTSHUL.ORG FOR MORE INFORMATION AND TO SIGN UP. $15 FOR ONE NIGHT, $35 FOR JANUARY SESSION, SEE NIGHTSHUL.ORG FOR FULL SEASON PRICING.
results.name: Let's create a community of adult Jewish learners

group.name: NightShul Learning Community at East Midwood Jewish Center

results.description:
Save money, sign up in advance ($20 for NYRR members registering in advance, $30 if you pay at the door):

http://www.armorytrack.com/gprofile.php?do=view_event&event_id=8196&mgroup_id=45586&year=2016


This is a well organized and fun indoor track meet open to all. Only a select number of events are offered at each meet. 


This meet's events:

Mile, Women's sections, then Men's
800m, Women's sections, then Men's
5,000m Relay, mixed/coed (5-person team and each runs 5 x 200 legs)

These meets are truly an opportunity for runners of all levels to get on the famous indoor track at the Armory. Join us for a fun time!

Cost: $25 for advance registration (NYRR members then receive a $5 refund), or $30 for day-of registration. Spectators are welcome, but please note that the Armory now charges a nominal fee ($10 last year) for non-runners.

Do not bring valuables, as it is hard to secure your stuff.  If you must bring something of value, bring a lock -- there is a limited number of available lockers at track level in the rear (beyond the shot put area).

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]

results.description:
Don't be intimidated by the title. This is still a go-at-your-own pace run, with stops and looping back for people. We just kindly suggest that you take it at your not-so-casual pace, whatever that may mean to you.

We will meet just inside the 52nd Street entrance to Windmuller Park at 7:15pm and head out for a 6ish mile loop through Woodside, Sunnyside, LIC, and Greenpoint, before returning to the start. 

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt. 

If there is interest after we complete our run, we may venture to a pub for snacks and/or beverages.


- - - - - - 
 Please see our full calendar of events

results.description:
This is an open Circle for all members.

This weekly session is to build upon the skills that you learned in our workshops. We get to practice and go into greater depth.

While many of my groups are run with a go with the flow attitude, this will:

• Begin and end on time

• 10 min opening meditation

• Cleansing

• A 10 min of discussion/question answer

• And 60 min of hands on application

• 10 min of closing

• We will begin promptly at 7:30 and end at 9:00

We will review and proceed to build on your existing knowledge and move together into new topics of exploration.

Your intuition requires practice and dedication to fully open and control. Should this group grow and demonstrate the need for more frequent gatherings, we will implement a schedule that meets on a more frequent basis.

results.description:
Whether you're completely new to meditation, fresh out of an MBSR class, or an advanced practitioner wanting to find a local sangha (supportive, like-minded individuals who help deepen your practice), this weekly meditation is open to all.

This week's group will include a guided sitting meditation in the Vipassana (Mindfulness) tradition and a short walking meditation. Our sit will be followed by question/answer and discussion. Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted. (Suggested donation $10, but please give what is right for you.)

* The Meetup RSVP list doesn't reflect actual attendance, since those from Insight Timer and other meditation groups also attend.

$15.00 Suggested Donation, $5.00 Minimum

Bring Your Own Hand Drum and/or Organic Percussion

The Drum Circle is fun & rewarding for all involved. You do not need to be a professional musician to participate in the circle - amateurs and experienced drummers alike can join-in.

We gather to share and create sacred rhythmic space for the intent of healing, self-empowerment and joy. We celebrate this space with tribal rhythms as we honor Fall release and prepare for Winter stillness, recognizing the interrelatedness of all things.

~ This ancient wisdom of sound therapy has been with us all along ~ Music has traditionally been used in healing practices for centuries. Now we have a great deal of scientific evidence to support what the ancients knew instinctively. Sound Can Heal!
results.name: Bring in the New Year Drumming!

results.description:
A group of professional designers, programmers and bloggers meets in Fair Lawn monthly. Come to a meeting and help shape the discussion. There's room for all interests and levels of web, design or technology involvement. Discussions take on shape according to who shows up any particular month. We meet at Panera Bread to take advantage of the free Wifi and the great onion soup! Bring your iphone or laptop and feel free to bring a friend!

Looking forward to seeing you at a meeting soon!

Kimi Wei thewei.com
Contact me via Meetup organizer link.

Meeting Attendance Fees No fee for web and technology professionals. Individuals NOT web or technology professionals pay an attendance fee of $10. FAQ about this policy. Employment agents and direct employers:
Company agents looking to hire and headhunters may attend a meeting for up to 30 minutes without paying a fee. This should give you time to assess member's interest in networking with you and to hand out cards. If you would like to make a presentation or sponsor the group for a meeting or series of meetings please contact me. New or existing company looking for freelancers or wanting site critiques
For a $50 fee you may attend a meeting and interact casually with group members for about an hour, but you may not solicit targeted advice about your project or website at that meeting. If you want the group to provide a site critique, or you need help with solutions for your site/project please contact me to set up a brainstorming session. Cost will be discussed at that time.

results.description:
Little known Japanese restaurant in Hackensack, but very good quality. The chef is actually Japanese. They have both sushi and cooked Japanese food. The place is not BYOB. They're not expensive but the portion sizes can be small, but the food is very fresh and good. Inside it's quiet with a quaint decor. I like this place because it's such an odd-ball hole in the wall; you'd never even realize there's a Japanese restaurant there unless you were paying attention, or at least you wouldn't expect someone to put a Japanese restaurant on that street.

There is a municipal parking lot just up the street, as well as lots of Hackensack street parking.

I'd be up for bowling afterwards.
results.name: Miyoshi Japanese Restaurant

Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.
results.how_to_find_us: http//:speakandlead.toastmastersclubs.org
results.name: Speak and Lead Toastmasters: Speaking and Leading the Way to Success

TONIGHT is a very special night. In addition to our typical Potluck/Mixer night, we are adding a game of Hot Seats!

Hot Seats is the game where you get to put your undivided attention on another human being. The game where many people have their first experience of being seen for who they really are. The game that fuels the fire at OneTaste NYC’s famous “TurnON” event. Tonight we slow it all down and show you how to cultivate the attention and openness to see others and be seen in a way that makes life more exciting and alive!

Call or text Dave at (347)[masked] with any questions.

results.description:
Please, read carefully before you RSVP!!

This will be the official Korean beginner's class. The class material will be provided. We will go through all the basics and foundations, and practice with fun activities.

Level description:

We will practice mostly the basic sentence structure using proper particles. Basic action verbs, verb conjugation, present tense, and pronunciation & speaking. You must know Hangul and can read/write comfortably

Since I need to book a space ahead, please consider your RSVP seriously and let me know if you can't make it after you said YES to come.

Please, email me at [masked] with your contact number if you can come. I will send mine so we can communicate better when the meet up happens.

The class fee will be $15 per person. Once you commit for 4 weeks series of classes it will be $40. Please, note you won't get a credit if you cancel your attendance on the same day. Be prepared for the class! :)

We may hang out and mingle after the class. I'm very excited to see you all and look forward to it! 
If you have any questions,please leave a comment.
results.how_to_find_us: Come into the building next to E,M,6 train NE entrance on 53rd and lexington ave. We are seating by the elevators.

results.description:
For those who attend meet ups a lot, we will be charging a $50 Monthly fee and you can attend all the meet ups you like, we will Definitely have every Tuesday & Thursdays 7-8:30PM & Fridays 8-930 PM Weekend slots will Vary & Monday, & Wednesdays will be added once we get more members attending. NO CONTRACT NO REGISTRATION pay the months you attend! unlimited soccer $50 (First 20 people to sign up only)

Want to play soccer, burn some energy? Release some stress? Play the sport you LOVE? Then come join us at SOCCER R US Indoor soccer facility, catering services to all you soccer players! COED PICK UP SOCCER. Come experience an awesome YEAR ROUND Indoor soccer facility in Brooklyn NEW YORK. Prospect Park train station on the Q OR B Train or S shuttle. Buses close by are the B41, 43, 16, 48 & 49


Indoor Soccer Facility with Real Turf Right by Prospect Park (Elevator available for bike riders)

FUTSAL In the Morning Before Work, During Lunch and Late Evenings

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. Start time Vary So stay Tuned and look out for the time slots that suit you best

Real Turf, Please wear flats. 2 flights upstairs from entrance door or take elevator to 3rd floor

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.
results.how_to_find_us: text or call 718-734-8469
results.name: Play Soccer (Real Turf)

results.description:
This Thursday is a new potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC (and anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!) where we will be playing one of our favorite games, Hot Seats! 

Hot Seats is a fun communication game where one person at a time can volunteer to have the attention the rest of the group placed on them for 1-2 minutes while they can be asked any question on any topic. You can chose to lie, tell the truth, or pass, but it's always encouraged to let your true self come out in a safe a fun environment.

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. 

It's a casual atmosphere that will include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

The event is free! The door will open at 7:45 and lock at 8:10 sharp, so please get here on time.

$10 at door or free if you bring a dish to share!

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]  
Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

*Lineup subject to change

results.description:
“Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord” (Ps 33:12, KJV)

Special Guest Speaker Michael Peroutka, attorney-at-law and co-founder of Institute on the Constitution (TheAmericanView.com), will kick off the Christian Party of America’s 2016 Town hall conference calls, which are open to the public  You can read more about Michael Peroutka in the biography below.

Biography: Michael Anthony Peroutka

A Christian and an attorney, Michael Anthony Peroutka is co-founder of Institute on the Constitution (IOTC), headquartered in Pasadena, Maryland. He is a graduate of Loyola College (now University) in Maryland and University of Baltimore School of Law.

Discovering that the teaching of the law in America had been perverted away from its original design, Michael determined to investigate America’s founding and the roots of our law, in English Common Law and the Bible. This led to the founding of Institute on the Constitution, which is an educational outreach of the law firm of Peroutka and Peroutka, also in Pasadena, Maryland. IOTC presents the real view -- the founders’ view -- which is the American view of law and government.

The Constitution Party’s candidate for President in 2004, Michael had a platform which sought to honor God, protect the family, and restore the Republic. The platform came to be known as “The American View of Law and Government,” and inspired the name of his website, TheAmericanView.com. IOTC teaches that American view:

There is a God, the God of the Bible.

Our rights come from Him.

The purpose of civil government is to secure our God-given rights.

Michael Peroutka has traveled around the country, graduating classes from IOTC’s course on the United States Constitution, in addition to teaching classes in IOTC’s Pasadena, Maryland classroom. Under his instruction, those who take the course become very familiar with the words, meaning and purpose of the Declaration of Independence and the U.S. Constitution, as well as the Biblical principles on which those founding documents are based. IOTC teaches the only known course on the Maryland Constitution, and a course on the lawful duty and role of the Jury.

______________________________________

Please join the Christian Party of America’s monthly Town Hall Conference Call to discuss current political issues with like-minded Christians. The Town Hall conference call is the second Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central). Don Watson, National Vice-Chairman and North Carolina State Chairman will lead the discussion on what can be done to address the concerns we all share for the status of our country’s civil government. Luis Chiang, National Advisory Board Member and Director of the Prayer Team, will lead us in prayer to close the call. Guest speakers will be present at some of the calls to provide input on political issues.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other Christian Party supporters as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. Our Town Hall conference calls are open to the public and are for all of us who are interested in the Christian Party of America. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call.

"If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land." (2 Chronicles 7:14 KJV)
results.name: MICHAEL PEROUTKA-SPEAKER AT CHRISTIAN PARTY OF AMERICA TOWN HALL CONFERENCE CALL

results.description:
Claudia Jennings stars as Karen Walker, a woman who sets her sights for roller derby success. Released a few months after Raquel Welch's Kansas City Bomber, Unholy Rollers gives the Welch film a run for its money, despite its exploitation budget, by adding nudity and lesbianism. After being sexually harassed by her loutish boss at the factory, Karen walks out of her job and tries out for the roller derby. She quickly wins a spot on the team and rises to the top, intent on ignoring the violence and grandstanding and concentrating on winning games. Although her teammates dislike her, Karen becomes a hit with the roller derby fans. But soon, her desire for victory becomes an obsession and she ends up losing not only her cool but also most of her clothes.


*This movie stars one of my first crushes, the lovely Claudia Jennings, who sadly died in a head-on car collision in 1978*

**As with all Deuce screenings, I encourage you to buy your tickets in advance, as they almost always sell out.  http://www.nitehawkcinema.com/movie/unholy-rollers/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_h9T-EmZfMA

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."

**Please have at least one form of government issued ID with you when you attend. The name provided in the RSVP question must match the name printed on your government issued ID. RSVPs will close noon, the day before (1/14/2016, 12:30 pm)  in order to submit the list to our host**

You MUST register online at this link, RSVPing on this site will not get you in. You must register on the Cisco page

http://demand.cisco.com/EE151125223_NOV_LPM


Most traditional enterprise networks are not nimble enough to keep up with today’s rapidly changing business requirements, the demands of cloud and mobile computing, and the proliferation of data.Programmable networking addresses these demands by enabling IT organizations to respond in minutes instead of days, automate time-consuming manual tasks, and simplify management.Join us for a series of discussions and technical labs on programmable networks and learn how Cisco provides the most comprehensive set of network programming options currently available.You will discover how to create a programmable network with Cisco® Open NX-OS, implement network programmability, and discern the right approach for your organization.

Agenda:

8:30–9:00 a.m.Registration and Continental Breakfast

9:00–10:00 a.m.Why Programmability?

10:00–11:00 a.m.Linux for Network Engineers

11:00–11:15 a.m.Break

11:15 a.m.–12:15 p.m.Linux Lab

12:15–1:00 p.m.Lunch

1:00–1:45 p.m.Python Primer

1:45–2:45 p.m.Automation Presentation and Demonstration

2:45–3:00 p.m.Break

3:00–4:30 p.m.Automation Lab

results.description:
Hello Fam!

We started the year off right with Eric Green of DaoCloud last week. Originally, we were suppose to have Taku of Peatix come. However, due to an emergency trip to Japan we had to reschedule him to March. Instead, we're excited to have Vidyuth Srinivasan of Entrupy come and share!

Vidyuth is the co-founder and CEO of Entrupy Inc. Entrupy is a brilliant new portable device that’s designed to instantly authenticate designer bags. He has been working on Entrupy since 2011 and was the only full-time employee for 2.5 years.


He moved to New York from India in 2012 to build it's HQ.  Previously, he played a variety of roles in various industries - made short-films, designed games and built a services business at a game development studio (Raptor Entertainment). He also managed a PR and marketing communication team at Microsoft India and Intuit India. He is a journalist by education, having graduated from Bangalore University (India) in 2006.


We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay warm and classy... See you then!

Future events:

1/22 - Joshua Siegel (Rubicon VC)

1/29 - Frank Barletta (LiveUpTop)
2/05 - Owen Davis (Overlap & NYC Seed)

2/19 - Tiffany Yu (Diversability)

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.
results.name: Chair Yoga Class

results.description:
Sign up Here

Join Robert Caplin and his guest, veteran news photographer Gary Hearshorn for a live podcast recording at Adorama's Event Space as they talk about Gary's career and transition into working for the social app Flipboard. You can come and watch us in person, or tune in live at PhotoBrigade.com/LIVE

Gary Hershorn has been working with app Flipboard since 2014, but began his career in 1979, working for Untied Press Canada in Toronto. In 1985 when Reuters purchased the foreign picture service of UPI he became the Chief Photographer, Canada for Reuters. In 1990 he moved to Washington DC as a senior photographer for Reuters where he continued in that roll until 2000. In 2000 he moved into a management role when he was appointed Picture Editor, America's for Reuters. In 2011 he became the Global Editor, Sports Pictures, a position he stayed in until his departure from Reuters in the spring of 2014. Gary has covered 16 Olympics, 24 Masters golf tournaments, 24 Academy Awards on top of numerous Super Bowl's, Stanley Cups, World Series', NBA Finals and other major news, sports and entertainment events. ➟ GaryHershorn.com
results.name: Podcast: Photo Brigade with Gary Hershorn

results.description:
Grab a juice and hear me, Sasha, 7-year Orgasmic Meditation practitioner speak on why I practice!

Orgasmic Meditation (OM for short) is a consciousness practice, like how yoga or meditation is, only we aim to stay conscious in the highly-charged field of sex and relationships. It's a practice where a stroker strokes the upper-left hand quadrant of a clitoris for 15 minutes.  It's totally goalless - the only goal is to feel. Aka, no goal of climax!

Sounds crazy? Weird? Yep - it did to me too.  And a quiet voice inside of me told me to explore more.  I'll break down what this practice really is. How it's affected my life/sex/mood/everything.  How you can expect it'll change your everything.  And why, 7 years later, I keep practicing.

The format is this: I'll introduce myself, we'll do a few communication games to get everyone landed in the room, and then I'll do a mini-lecture on Orgasmic Meditation.  Then I'll field your questions.  

At the end of the hour I'll tell you about how you can get started on the path of Orgasmic Meditation. What your next step is.

Practitioners of OM have reported the following benefits:

It lights you up from the inside out. 
Increased Energy. 
Your sex becomes what it was meant to be. 
Increased ability to feel and know your desire. 
Clarity on what you want. 
Elongated sexual pleasure during intercourse. 
Yes, that “place” extends. 
Increased confidence with your body & in the bedroom. 
Gain skills of concentration & attention. 
Diminishes chronic dissatisfaction. 
Reduces stress & irritability. 
Increased intimacy with your partner. 
OM creates more communication. 
You will communicate better, feel more connected, and have more overall TurnON for life.

https://youtu.be/pYohBt5AVmA

This event is free!

Call/Text Sasha for more information:  (650)[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us in the "TurnedON" Shirts!
results.name: What Is Orgasmic Meditation?

results.description:
NOTE: YOU MUST BUY A TICKET ON EVENTBRITE TO SECURE A SPOT.

The New York-North Jersey Young Members group is headed to Lake Placid on MLK Weekend for a weekend of skiing and other winter activities, and we'd love for you to join us!!! Lake Placid is the nation's first winter resort and is a classic northeast ski town with its shoreside shops, restaurants and pubs.

We'll be skiing at the nearby Whiteface Mountain, which is one of the premier skiing destinations in the northeast (ranked #6 in SkiNet's "2015's Top-Ranked Eastern Ski Resorts"). If you're a beginner, my friend will offer free lessons or you can sign up for instruction at the slopes. There are plenty of other winter activities for non-skiers or for folks that wish to mix things up - go snowshoeing in the Adirondacks, snow tubing at the Olympic Jump Complex and/or ice skating or tobogganing at Mirror Lake.

For registration instructions and additional details about the trip, please visit us here: http://bit.ly/1YwgLjw

To view photos of downtown Lake Placid, Whiteface Mountain and the lodge, please visit us here:  http://on.fb.me/1SmKGHj

For additional information on Whiteface Mountain and Lake Placid, visit here: http://nyti.ms/1Xjtau7

You will not want to miss this BIG EVENT!

Please note the sleeping rooms are 2 queen beds per room.

This is a resort you will have full access to:

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

results.description:
The Queen's Code for Relationships (Formerly Celebrating Men & Marriage™)

Whether you want a relationship, have one or are getting over one, this 3-day workshop will transform how you experience love, romance and partnership. 

You’ll dispel the fantasies, get to the bottom of the conflicts and disappointments, and gain understanding and tools that you can use immediately.

A 3-Day Workshop for Women In New York City, January 15-17, 2016 

To find out more about the course and to register, go HERE. </a>

Women must be graduates of The Queen's Code Workshop (formerly known as Celebrating Men, Satisfying Women™) AND also The Queen's Code for Life (formerly known as the "Queen" course). 

DATE: January 15-17, 2016  (Friday, Saturday and Sunday)

TIME:  2-7:30 pm Friday, 10am-6pm Saturday and Sunday

WHERE:  New York City. You will receive the hotel location after you have paid for the weekend workshop. 

COST: The Workshop is 100% Money Back Guaranteed!

As a First Time Participant in This Workshop, your Tuition includes: 

• 30 Minutes of post-workshop, private coaching with a Queen’s Code for Relationships Workshop Leader. 

• A three-session Bonus Teleclass expanding upon what you learned in your workshop and answering questions. Live and recorded for downloading.

Discover the source of our struggles to have satisfying, committed partnerships. And change your future! 

In the Queen’s Code for Relationships, You Will: 

• Get the information you need to make sure you can be a Queen in your romantic relationships...instead of a doormat, nag or worse.

• Examine how we relate to marriage as women – out of instinct, based on fairy tales and striving for status – and how that prevents us from picking partners that bring out the Queen. 

Looking for a Committed Relationship? 

Learn the 12 things that make a woman “The Right Person to Marry” 

• See how we’ve become the OPPOSITE of what men need to GET married and STAY happily married.

• Understand the huge differences in how men experience commitment, marriage and the progression of relationships.

• End the frustration, confusion and injuries to your self-esteem.

• Gain the freedom to accept your needs and create the relationship of your dreams (not someone else’s).

Sort what you really need to be happy from the false expectations hyped by magazines, movies and, even, your mother.

Select more intelligently and efficiently, maximizing your time and energy.

Trying to Make a Relationship Work? 

All partnerships are challenging. Understanding makes the difference. 

• Come to terms with what successfully living together requires and leave with the skills and tools you need.

• Find out how predictable conflicts become problems if ignored, but when addressed could actually create a structure for love, romance, and fulfillment.

• Learn how to negotiate deals that make life easier, more fulfilling and fun – and make them stick. 

Give yourself credit for what you're doing right.

Learn the small adjustments that make the big improvements, even saving marriages and families.


 Getting Over a Relationship? 

End the cycle of suffering. Heal so you can love and partner again. 

• Learn what really happened so you don’t repeat the same mistakes.

• Stop blaming yourself for what wasn’t your fault.

• Gain the confidence that you have the ability, skills and tools to make a relationship work.

Keep the lessons. Leave the pain behind. Renew Hope.


“Until women have grappled with their instinctive and cultural relationship to marriage, we cannot truly be ourselves. Our self-expression will be circumscribed by the need to prove our independence while simultaneously seeking the biggest, strongest, most resourceful adversary to marry. This workshop transforms romantic relationships at their core, providing access to freedom and partnership in many forms.” – Alison Armstrong 

To see complete details about the workshop, and to learn more about PAX, go to: <a href="http://www.understandmen.com/">http://www.understandmen.com/

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
We are returning to another nice Vermont ski resort Mount Snow for action packed weekday ski/snowboard trip, and to save $100+ comparing to weekend trip.

Why Mount Snow

We know you have options. And we know your time is valuable. Most of all, we know that ski trips are all about getting away from it all and having fun. We believe Mount Snow encompasses everything a great ski vacation is made of. Here’s why.

The Bluebird Express
Mount Snow is the only place in North America where you will find a high speed detachable six passenger bubble lift. We call it the Bluebird Express, for short. This $8.5 million technologically advanced chairlift was brand new for the 2011/2012 season and it is nothing short of incredible. The bubbles on each chair can be lowered by the passengers to provide similar protection as a gondola cabin, but with the convenience of keeping skis and boards on their feet. The seven minute ride from base to summit is so smooth the only reason you would want it to end is so you can enjoy another amazing run down one of Mount Snow’s 80 trails. Read more about the Bluebird Express, the only lift of its kind in North America.

Snow Lake Lodge

For this trip, we will stay at Snow Lake Lodge, Mount Snow's lakeside hotel with spectacular views of the mountain, Snow Lake Lodge is a real value.  A free shuttle will take you to and from the slopes and you are walking distance from a great evening of entertainment at the Snowbarn (winter only). After a full day of play, take a soothing sauna, hop into the indoor or outdoor hot tub or visit the arcade. You’ll sleep well knowing your next day of fun on the slopes is just steps away

 Features:

Game room
Sauna
Whirlpool
Complimentary continental breakfast
Hot Tub
Wireless Internet
Complimentary Hi-speed Internet
Fireplace

 *** Trip plan email will be sent out to everyone confirmed (including those paid by Chase Quickpay) via Eventbrite 2 to 3 days before the departure date providing trip logistics and details. ***

Trip Includes: 3 days 3 nights ski/snowboard trip; 3 nights accommodation at Snow Lake Lodge (2 persons in a two double beds room). 3 days all mountain lift tickets at Mount Snow. Benz Sprinter van round trip transportation from NYC, daily shuttle transportation between lodge & ski resort, tolls, & parking fee if any. 3 daily breakfasts.

Additional Cost: 3 day Rental (skis or snowboard) is group rate $99; Ski rental includes skis, boots and poles. Snowboard rental includes snowboard and boots. $50 more to upgrade 1st day lift tickets to Intro to Skiing or Snowboarding.

results.description:
The Edgar Cayce Center has been our place for hosting Dr. Pang Ming Zhineng Qigong. Zhineng Qigong "is a training which enables the participants to transform natural instinctive activities into conscious activities." -Zhineng Qigong: Overview & Foundation Methods, Selected writings by Dr. Pang Ming, Translated by Hou Hee Chan. 

Carl Gustav Jung, the Swiss psychiatrist and psychotherapist who founded analytical psychology also had a similar view - “Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.” - 

Edgar Cayce was a renowned healer who connected to the universal consciousness and his 'readings' gives some insight into healing - "For all healing, mental or material, is attuning each atom of the body, each reflex of the brain forces, to the awareness of the divine that lies within each atom, each cell of the body."

Please join us this Friday as we study the practice and  the theories of Zhineng Qigong. 

Beginners and experienced practitioners are welcomed!

cost $5

results.description:
Please join NYC Animal Defense League and No New Animal Lab for our #StormSkanska: Swarm New York kick-off protest in front of Skanka USA's headquarters at the Empire State Building!


After the protest, we will make our way to NYU Law school for the second half of the days events:


https://www.facebook.com/events/1650770105196003/


The protest will take place on the 34th street entrance between 5th & 6th avenue.

Transporation:

Take the BDFM or NRQ to 34th st-- Herald Sq

or take the 6 train to 33rd street.


About the campaign:

In December of 2012, Skanska USA was granted a contract from the University of Washington for the development and construction of the Animal Research & Care Facility, a covert underground lab intended to centralize animal research and vastly increase the number of animals that will be caged, abused, and killed. It was at this moment that Skanska chose to involve itself with the vivisection industry and to profit from the imprisonment and torture of endless generations of animals by literally burying them underground. They were eagerly prepared to make millions. What they were not prepared for was the animal liberation movement.


The No New Animal Lab campaign was our response. We began organizing to stop them. We planned to #StormSkanska. Dozens of actions against Skanska have spanned dozens of cities -- from handing out leaflets to shutting down their construction site through direct action. The pressure has always been escalating and intensifying. It continues to build.

Please visit www.nonewanimallab.com for more information.
results.name: #SwarmNY: Skanska Headquarters Protest

results.description:
Join us for an evening of discussion, food, and drinks at the Gastro Bar @ 35th, at the Tryp Hotel in Midtown Manhattan. Our creative placemaking panel features 4 speakers coming from interdisciplinary backgrounds in design, community-based artmaking, architecture, restoration, and climate resiliency. Each practitioner will share their insights, from case studies and projects, exploring an important narrative about the intersection of creative placemaking, revitalization, and growth.

Dan Horn “Bayanihan: Community Driven Resilience”

Marcus Wilford “Urban Interventions: Spaces That Activate the City”

Zoey Hart, Yasmeen Abdallah “Brooklyn Dreams In Color” (developed in collaboration with Hanna Wellish)

This event is part of GreenspaceNYC’s Civic Art Lab project, which first launched as a community-based storefront in Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn, developed in collaboration with the Bridge Street Development Corporation’s pop-up program. This environmental, arts, and educational initiative called on neighbors to co-produce creative and open ways to share skills and showcase recent cultural and environmental initiatives. In July & August 2015, we hosted over 40 workshops. GreenspaceNYC is a non-profit design collaborative that develops and curates free educational programming, hands-on workshops, and public projects that encourage dialogue, enliven public spaces, and promote the future of a more equitable and sustainable city.

Questions? Email [masked].

Sponsors include:

Material for the Arts (NYC Office of Cultural Affairs), Fractured Atlas, ORLI Operation Resilient Long Island, sun|tect: architecture

To learn more about GreenspaceNYC and their projects, please visit www.greenspacenyc.org.

Follow us on Twitter: @greenspacenyc

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
**MUST RSVP | CLICK HERE TO ATTEND**

This class is NOT FREE. Tickets must be purchased via Link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/scrum-master-certificatesmc-masterclass-tickets-19786255222

The Scrum Master Certificate (SMC) is a 1-day course that covers the best practices and tools to effectively manage a software engineering team. These tools relate to behavioral shifts, working with multiple teams in the fastest-growing technology companies in New York City.


Students learn through instruction and team-based exercises and are challenged to think in terms of the Scrum principles to better understand what to do when returning to the workplace. Each class is intentionally limited to 14 students to provide the best possible learning experience, and all the students that get an 80/100 score or higher on the assessment test will earn the Scrum Master Certificate (SMC). 

The class will be taught by Sophia Huang - Product Manager at CheapOair and Lead Product Management Instructor at Product School.

What you will learn: 

• How to manage a software engineering team, increasing the likelihood of the product's overall success. 

• Scrum best practices to provide a level of knowledge beyond typical project management. 

How to protect your team from both internal and external distractions. 

Who is this class for: 

• Software engineers who want to transition to a Product Management role 


• Business professionals in finance/consulting who want to work in high-tech companies

• Project Managers, Marketers, Designers who are seeking for new opportunities in Product Management 

Timeline:

• 6:00 - 8:30 pm: Scrum Master Certificate (SMC) class

• 8:30 - 8:45 pm: Scrum Master Certificate (SMC) assessment test 

• 8:45 - 9:00 pm: Networking with snacks & refreshments

Prerequisites: 

The class is geared towards helping you make a transition to a Product Manager career path in a software company. We welcome applications from talented professionals with 5+ years of relevant experience who live in the New York City Area.

Class syllabus: 


1- Introduction to Scrum
This module covers the rationale for Agile/Scrum, along with an overview of roles, meetings, and most popular tools. 

2- Backlog Review Meeting
This module covers how to recognize well-formed Product Backlog Items, user story examples, a team effort estimation game (story point estimation), decomposition of large PBIs (e.g. "epics") into smaller ones (e.g. "user stories"), acceptance criteria, definition of done, Product Backlog prioritization, the Scrum Product Owner role, and team self-organization. 

3- Sprint Planning Meeting Duration
This module covers the first official meeting in the Scrum cycle. Subtopics include the difference between the Product Backlog vs. the Sprint Backlog, how to break PBIs into Sprint Tasks, timeboxing, what is a "potentially shippable product increment", definition of done, planning for testing within a Sprint, limiting Work In Progress (WIP), team volunteerism, and commitment-based planning. 

4- Daily Scrum Meeting
This module covers the second and most frequent meeting in the Scrum cycle. Subtopics include effective use of the taskboard, team self-organization, how to incorporate varying skills on one team, the Scrum Master role during Sprint Execution, pros and cons of involving the Product Owner each day, the three questions, and keeping the meeting short. 

5- Sprint Review/Demo Meeting
This module covers the meeting held after the execution of each Sprint in which the team conducts a live demonstration of the working product increment for the Product Owner. For those outside the team, this is the most visible part of Scrum. Subtopics include: Acceptance criteria and definition of done, velocity, transparency, how to involve external stakeholders, and emergent requirements in the Product Backlog. 

6- Sprint Retrospective Meeting
This module covers the final meeting associated with each Sprint. In this meeting, the team reflects on the Sprint to raise its own awareness of what transpired. It ends with agreements about specific adaptations for future Sprints.


Frequently asked questions:

What’s difficulty level are we talking about here? 

The Scrum Master Certificate (SMC) is a 1-day course that’s been developed for professionals with little to no experience in product management. Can I expense this for my company or write it off for my business?
Yes, and we can help you prepare any additional documentation that your employer may need.

What’s included in the price? 

The price includes access to the class, the Scrum Master Certificate (SMC) and lifetime access to our perks platform

How can I obtain the Scrum Master Certificate (SMC)? 

Upon completion of the class, and an 80/100 score or higher on the assessment test, you'll earn the Scrum Master Certificate (SMC). You will be able to use it in your LinkedIn profile and resume.

Why should I attend Scrum training instead of just reading books and online articles? 

You'll spend most of your class time in interactive team activities going beyond the basic concepts into practical application and case studies.

I already do some kind of Scrum at my company, how can this certificate benefit me and my team?

Each agile company adapts Scrum to their own needs, and this is a great opportunity to take a step back and learn how you can incorporate some of the best practices to your current process. Moreover, you will have the opportunity to learn how each of the companies represented in class apply Scrum. 

Meet the instructor:

Sophia Huang is a Product Manager at CheapOair, Lead Instructor at Product School, and Scrum Master with 9 years of experience of cross-functional leadership in digital and mobile production, agile/lean development, roadmap strategy, and multi-million business building, from both agency and client-side. 

Host:

Product School offers Product Management Training Courses in San Francisco, Silicon Valley, and New York.

This class is NOT FREE. Tickets must be purchased via Link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/scrum-master-certificatesmc-masterclass-tickets-19786255222
results.name: The Scrum Master Certificate (SMC) Masterclass

results.description:
Hi everyone, 

Let's welcome the New Year at a familiar location. The DJ who played at our last 2015 meetup will not start stirring up the place until about 10:00pm, so there will be more time for conversation and getting to know new members before the place gets loud.

Holland House has now upgraded to a full bar (rather than just beers), so there are more choices for your drinks.

NOTE: When opening a tab, especially while seated at a table, make sure the staff understands that is YOUR PERSONAL TAB ONLY so no-one accidentally adds items to your bill.

VICE VERSA: If a staff member serves you without asking for cash or card, make sure to approach them to avoid someone else having to foot your bill.

Beers

Holland House is famous for their beer selection: About 150 beers are available: 35 on draft, and over 100 bottle beers.

If you are the adventurous type, they have a whole selection of beer cocktails as well.

Happy Hour

$5 for select draft beers until 07:00PM

For our group only, they will extend the Happy Hour until 08:00PM.

Please see me at the event before you go to the bar after 07:00PM.

Usually about 10 drinks are listed on the Happy Hour menu.

Food

Yes, they also have a food menu. We will have some high tables reserved for us, so you will have a place to put down your plate if you decide to order food.

Cover Charge?

None! Our monthly meetup is free of charge as always.

If you like to help offset the cost for maintaining our group, you can make a $1 donation to our piggy bank, it is well appreciated but there is absolutely no obligation to do so.

How do I get there by train?

N/R - 28th St: 3 blocks

6 - 28th St: 4 blocks

B/D/F/M/Q - 34th St Herald Sq: 4 blocks

1 - 28th St: 4 blocks (a bit further than the others)

Please look at your RSVP and change it if your plans have changed so we can keep the venue updated on our expected attendance.

I hope everyone has a wonderful start into the New Year!

See you on the 15th!

Thomas

[masked]

results.description:
Holistic Hangout

(typically every 3rd Friday of the month)

Relax, Unwind, Refresh

When climbing the mountain of enlightenment, growth, self-development, healing, and spirituality it can be good to stop and catch your breath.

Share, Connect and Exchange!

Meet fellow seekers off the mat, outside the circle, beyond the classroom.

Rest your 3rd eye

Revive your Chakras

Fill your heart with good company, food and drink.


COME OUT & PLAY WITH US at the WHOLE FOODS CAFE!


Stop by for a little, Stop by for a lot,

Stop by on your way or Stop by and stay,

Stop by for some stimulating conversation and a bite to eat with unique and interesting people who share an interest in the diversity of holistic and alternative news, views and practices. We are experimenting with this new, quieter space with more freedom to mingle, move, chat and exchange.

This is a very casual event.  No agenda, just simple conversation, meet and mingle.

Share adventures, experiences, health tips, intentions and more

Learn about interesting classes

Meet healers, practitioners and coaches

 If you are just beginning to explore or been exploring for a while, we welcome you.  It is amazing how so many people who are attracted find that they have natural abilities of healing, coaching, energyworking or even more amazing skills.

Make Great Connections in an inviting social setting

We Look Forward To Welcoming Back Old Friends & Meeting New Ones Too!

You can Register here on Meetup or on EventBrite

Many Blessings,


Joel Elfman & Michael Balice


***We are often joined by members from several other Meetup groups this event is posted to.
results.how_to_find_us: we'll have some signs out at the tables on the upper level

results.description:
RE:ARTISTE International Art Organization is hosting the art exhibit, “SHOW YOUR WORLD”, on January 15-17, 2016.

Enjoy art, wine, and a performance of our musical guests: jazz pianist Marina Makarova, opera singers Zoya Gramagin and Robert-Heepyoung Oh. Meet the Winner and the Finalists of the art competition, "Show Your World".

This FREE event celebrates the results of the “Show Your World” International Art Competition: artists of various media from 43 countries have submitted the artwork reflecting and depicting the world as they see it.

This is not a conventional art show – this is also an international social event inviting people to participate in artist talks, workshops, casual hangouts while enjoying art from all over the globe.


The artists from the following countries take part in the show: USA, Israel, Russia, UK, Australia, Hong Kong, France, Ukraine, Spain, Germany, Japan, Uruguay, to name a few.

About RE:ARTISTE International Art Organization:
Our mission is exposing amateur and professional artists to curators, buyers, art enthusiasts. Art can be a powerful force in peace making. Often, to research and understand the history of mankind, people use works of art as an illustration or proof of the historical and social facts, human lifestyle, inspiration, and feelings, in a historic discourse.
Through the eyes of artists and photographers, we see the world. Through the artists’ vision we are able to view the unseen. Therefore, exposing artists to the world is a peacemaking mission connecting people of various cultures, origins, and legacies. www.reartiste.com
results.name: OPENING: "Show Your World" Art Event

group.name: Art Terrace: Artists, Art Enthusiasts, Collectors network

Let's get prepared to RUMBLE! 

What's going on tonite? It's too early to tell! 

One thing is for sure, there will be socializing, purchasing, consuming of food and drink, and MINIATURE WARGAMING going on!

That's right, we're wargamers. We come to NBG on Fridays to show off our paint-jobs, talk about strategy, tell lies, laugh, crush our friends, and see their armies driven before us. If you are interested in wargaming, are looking for people to play with,  or are searching for a gaming community here in the Big Apple, this is the place for you. Come join us Friday night!

results.description:
Discussion talk: What does it mean to be gay and in NYC?

Come share your thoughts, feelings, ideas about your experience being gay and living in NYC? 

Topic Points to consider:

How do you find the NYC dating scene to be?

What is it like for you being a gay male in NYC?

What are the positives of gay life in NYC?

What are the disadvantages, biases, stereotypes present for gay guys in NYC?

How can we be our authentic self and find our comfort level as a gay male in the city?

Directions: The best way is to take the 7 train to 90th street Station. Exiting  the train, walk to the left and then, make a right onto 89th street. You will walk straight down 89th street past four avenues until you reach Northern boulevard. 

As you keep walking on 89th street, you will pass a red Santander bank. My place is across the street from a small park on 89th street.

***Please note it is a 10 minute walk in total to my place.  
***Please note I do have a cat named Chewy who looks forward to meeting you.

Press buzzer 23

Take elevator to 5th floor. Make a right through the grey fire door and walk to the end of the hall to apartment 510. 

There are other ways to get to my place but I think this is the simplest since you only take the 7 train and walk straight down 89th street to my apartment. 


***Please bring a snack or beverage to share with the group. We will have our discussion and hang out after to listen to music, snack, and chill.
results.how_to_find_us: Directions: The best way is to take the 7 train to 90th street station
results.name: Discussion talk: What does it mean to be gay in NYC

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

40 & Over Singles Mixer (Light Appetizers, Prizes, Ice Breakers)!

We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars among a bunch of 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our 40 & Over Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

WHEN: Friday, January 15th, 6:30 -10:30 PM (If coming in from a distance, it's okay if you arrive at 7:00 or after)
WHERE: Pranna Lounge (79 Madison Avenue, at 28th St. NYC)

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Suggested Age Range: 40s & 50s Plus Welcome To Attend
* Drink Specials!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 7 to 8
* Icebreakers With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

TICKET PRICE: $20

results.description:
Join us as we usher in the New Year at this Meet & Greet with socializing and talking photography or anything else for that matter!  Sandwiches and hot soup, chips and dip and other snacks and beverages will await you.  Bring images on a flash drive as we'll be showing member pics, sized to 1080 on the horizontal side and 768 on the vertical side.  Share your prints as well!


This event is also in conjunction with another photo Meetup group that I'm involved with and might interest you: Manhattan Lighting and Figure Study Workshops: http://www.meetup.com/figure-photography.  They'll be holding discussions and demos of working with models and lighting.  Other veteran shooters and models will be present to answer your questions.  See you there!

Please RSVP at right so we can get an accurate count for food and beverages! 

There is no charge for this event.
results.how_to_find_us: Come to back of studio.  Ask for Ed Lee, the Organizer!
results.name: NEW YEAR MEET & GREET, JANUARY 15, 2016, 6:30 PM!

results.description:
Hey Everypony,

Me and Jack were going to head to this event celebrating the new dinosaur cast the museum is unveiling, and wanted to see if anyone else would like to come.

Description copied from AMNH.org: Meet the newest resident of the Museum’s fossil halls, a 122-foot-long titanosaur, during a night of cocktails and conversation. Paleontologist Diego Pol, who was part of the team that discovered the fossil in 2014, joins Macaulay Curator of Paleontology Mark Norell and Provost of Science Mike Novacek for a salon-style chat about the stupendous sauropod and its scientific significance.

Tickets can be found here: http://www.amnh.org/calendar/toast-the-titanosaur

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001

So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! The new year is here and it's the perfect time to get out there and make new friends and find that special someone. We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20 & 30 somethings. That's why we've created this event filled with more mature singles (40 & 50+)!  

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/4087/dates/Jan-15-2016_at_0630PM

Prepay Only Event. Tickets Not Sold At Door. 

What to expect: 

• Free Light Appetizers (7-8pm) 

• Drink Specials

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• 100+ singles in their 30s, 40s, 50s+ 

• Ice Breakers & Prizes 

*MUST PURCHASE TICKET IN ADVANCE HERE ($20) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/4087/dates/Jan-15-2016_at_0630PM

*Price goes up to $30 as the event date gets closer. We recommend getting tickets ASAP to save $ and guarantee your spot. This event will sell out, especially for women. 

• As date gets closer, we may shut down tix for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced.  Get tix ASAP to secure your spot, especially women.

• Typically 75% of attendees come alone (25% bring friends) 

• Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts) 

• MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. 100+ SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

PREPAY ONLY - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/4087/dates/Jan-15-2016_at_0630PM

results.name: 40s & Over Singles Mixer (PREPAY ONLY) Sold Out For WOMEN!

results.description:
Get tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

40 & Over Singles Mixer (Light Appetizers, Prizes, Ice Breakers)!

We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars among a bunch of 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our 40 & Over Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

WHEN: Friday, January 15th, 6:30 -10:30 PM (If coming in from a distance, it's okay if you arrive at 7:00 or after)
WHERE: Pranna Lounge (79 Madison Avenue, at 28th St. NYC)

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Suggested Age Range: 40s & 50s Plus Welcome To Attend
* Drink Specials!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 7 to 8
* Icebreakers With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html
results.name: 40 & Over Singles Mixer (Light Appetizers, Prizes, Ice Breakers)!

results.description:
So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click event we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.

We get it... You want to meet someone special but don't feel like hanging out in bars amongst a bunch of recent college grads or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our  Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!

Drink Specials!

Win Prizes!

Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling

Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)

Suggested Age Range: late 30's to 50's

The Best Way To Meet Quality Singles in NYC

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

group.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists (& like minded)
